siWwENGHPhN5mZRaB5fBhg.text: The food is not bad, the wait was ridiculous, especially saying the restaurant was pretty empty. We waited over 40 minutes to get two burgers and fries, they got one of our orders wrong. The wait staff is not very attentive. Not sure I would come back, might want to stick to only take out.

ZIStGZo2ZbRvt60CBOU6Yg.text: This was the best burger ever. The service was excellent and great atmosphere.  If you're in the mood for tasting and delicious burger you need to try the Flippin' Burger.

WfCc5pHwcldTSTrNeBn4DQ.text: Second time here. First time service was... Interesting. He seemed like he was just hanging out and didn't care? I don't know. Food was ok. I had already told myself I wouldn't be back. Then I saw on Instagram they had a new item, fried pickles. Looked great. Tought I'd give them another chance. Service was worse this time. Our sever stared us down when she got to the table, it was really weird but I thought it must be me. So we get our food pretty quick. I asked for the red hot spicy pickles, they were no where near. She was nice when I asked about it but I decided to just eat them as is. I had ordered a water and took a sip and tasted something sweet. Weird right? Water that tastes sweet? Hm... So the night goes on, we get the check and I notice our server in the back corner staring at me talking to another worker behind the bar. Interesting... There was a problem with the check and I told my wife, "well she's starting at us, want me to wave her over?" She ended up just going to the host as our server stayed talking to the other girl and STARING! It was so weird. So since she was staring, she saw my wife at the hostess and went over and asked what the problem was. She had a total attitude. I don't get it. When my wife told her what was wrong she said, "well that's not a problem," and TOOK THE CHECK OUT OF HER HAND! Ok. Fine. Well right before leaving my wife found LIPSTICK on her glass. So our glasses weren't clean. No wonder my water tasted sweet. We won't be back. I just hope a manager sees this and does something about it because there won't be a third chance.

YASO6y9DTaCSSJD6dx7XTg.text: This is one of the best burgers I've had in a very long time. Amazing flavor!  PSA: I was not drinking at the time of consumption.  Wish I had one close to home.

7FGSQnHYLpnE0Rva3hChNg.text: Pretty good for downtown. Prices and portions are reasonable. Food was great menu selection was a bit on the small side. My only complaint was the concretes were a bit small! Order a malt instead.

W9_U_fe9u4XQjA9EmTZa5A.text: I have used Uber eats to order food from this establishment because it's affordable and right down the street from work.  Recently 2 out of 3 orders have been wrong (bur I've ordered many times) where I either received the wrong item or I just didn't receive all the items I paid for ( which seemed to be on the driver of uber eats). Uber now won't refund me because there were too many adjustments on my account.  I dont look for, nore do I need, handouts.  I just ask that my order be right.  And when it's not and feedback is left on an order for the business to see,  they should see that it gets corrected . Especially If it's for a small item like a milkshake.  So now I'm out of money that I spent to receive an item I was expecting.

27oJ6StVcoD1WlZYqajfjg.text: So I'm not sure if it was liquor that made Flippin' Good Burgers so great or was it in fact flippin' good? Alls I rememba is that the chili cheese fries actually had chili beans in them and were oddly similar to a batch I make at home. Super tasty!  Recently I've been into bbq burgers w/onion rings and the one I ordered from here was pretty legit. Hubby and sissy ordered the Farm Burger which came w/a fried egg and according to them yummy as well.  This place is not cheap, but if you're in the Fremont area and in the mood for yummy burgers this is the place.

IoJBb65ZkJZQHOgcChDmeA.text: I have only been here once and only ordered one thing which were the chicken fingers.  I really just wanted to have chicken fingers. I am not a big fan of overly breaded chicken fingers, but that is just my preference. The chicken finger itself had no flavor at all, just tasted oily and it was just very crunchy. The sauce that it came with was definitely the exception to the whole meal. I think it was their specialty sauce. I can't seem to remember what the name was. The establishment was super clean which is always an upside. I did notice that everyone was enjoying their burgers a lot! Maybe their burgers are much better. I'll have to try this place out again and maybe order a burger.

G68PutyYO1oh6TP2WdNSzA.text: Discovered this place through a Facebook video showcasing the flippin hot chicken sandwich. As someone who loves spicy food I had to try it. Went with a group of friends and when we ordered it our waiter, Bill, gave us a serious "are you sure?" face and we stuck with the challenge. For me personally, its heat certainly held up to its name. Definitely not for the faint of heart. Bill was very attentive to everything we needed. I will certainly go again but for something less hot. Fried pickles were good also.

i27s9h63wCZmgdinGef0RQ.text: My experience at this place was not a good one.  I was accused of placing an order that I did not ask for.  WAN was our server and brought our food out.  My order was wrong.  I asked for chicken tenders and fries.  When he brought my order out I told him I did not ask for chili fries he said I specifically heard you say you changed the order to chili fries.  He basically called me a liar and did not want to say he got the order wrong or anything.  I would have been okay with the whole situation if he would had just said my bad or let me  get you some plain fries.  My sister in law asked not to have cheese on her chicken sandwich and she received it up there anyway.  Wan tries to say that it was the burger that didn't need cheese.  I did not appreciate the way he responded to me at all.  The manager was very nice about it.  I will not be back again.

-1potlB_srdRLdv4tUye7Q.text: I really wanted to like this place. I was with my ex and the kids closing out our Las Vegas trip and we were wandering around Downtown Vegas trying to find a decent restaurant that wasn't a horribly overpriced chain.   At our first choice - Hash House a Go Go - we were virtually ignored by staff. I mean seriously, we were standing at the hostess counter for about 10 minutes and none of the staff acknowledged us or came to seat us - thanks a lot, a**holes!  By the time we walked the entire length of Fremont Street we stumbled upon this restaurant by accident and were starving. I love EAT in Downtown Las Vegas however we needed a kid-friendly place that could get the food out promptly as everyone was pretty "hangry" (hungry+angry) by the time we got there.  PROS: -It's brand new so everything is very clean and in good condition.  -Cashier was friendly and professional, seeming to go out of her way to address our concerns (more on that below).  -Has a variety of items on the menu and the frozen custard desserts are something different.  CONS: -We ordered the Banana Monkey frozen custard and it DID NOT look anything close to the pictures on the menu board. It didn't have any bananas or other toppings in it, and frankly looked pretty pathetic. To their credit, when we complained to the cashier who took our order, she brought us a second frozen custard that was prepared correctly at no charge.  -Food overall was pretty "meh," really nothing to write home. If you're solely a burger joint, you really have to nail it, IMO. Price didn't seem worth it as the food was pretty average.  As Fremont Street is pretty tourist-trappy, you could do worse however in hindsight I wish we went to Pizza Rock instead. Could our grumpiness have attributed to the lower rating? I don't think so. Am hoping some of the issues are related to their "new-ness" and that they eventually get the kinks out to can improve operations and quality.

fuI-AAWt0VM25OLgbqqoRw.text: An oasis on Fremont street.  Cool, clean, good people working here, good food.  Get out of the heat, and pee smell, and relax in here.  Bring your core temp down with a shake, drink, and some AC.  They have a nice root beer float here.

w-v0XZImZ835GoDgbmloQw.text: What a great Burger! Best one I've had in a really long time , when I go back to Vegas I'm coming back here for sure, every time I come to Vegas I'm eating here !

pa8lib8aGildCsUnJ7xaEw.text: Very good, got take out delivered to our hotel. The ingridients taste fresh, chicken is perfectly fried, sauces bold and tangy, and fries have a nice natural taste to them.

kFBwKc2ziNAClnCC7qNQzg.text: Met friends here for what we hoped would be a good burger. Unfortunately not so much. In & Out is much much better with half the cost. The fries weren't horrible but definitely nothing special. I ordered the Farm burger and onion rings. The onion rings were the best thing I tried.   On the plus side, the location is great. There is a paid parking lot around the corner which made for a short walk to the restaurant. The interior is very clean and spacious. We had 7 people and plenty of space to hang out and watch the basketball game.   If we happen to come back, I will only try a shake.

8J1RnSgSMgy7XBSwzs4phA.text: Never been here before and stumbled upon them late at night and the burgers and chili cheese fries were awesome!  Kinda like fat burger but even better! Would definitely come back!  Even better than the food was the customer service! Jessica was so amazing and honest! After my cousin accidentally left his backpack as we were catching our Uber, we called them when we got to our hotel and Jessica had it. Even though they just closed they still answered the phone and after asking some questions about the backpack to confirm it was ours we came back to the restaurant and picked it up. I tried to give her a $5 tip for her honesty and time, which was all I had on me(it's Vegas don't judge me hahaha) she wouldn't take it. So thankful there are still good people in the world, especially in Vegas!   I just called the manager and let him know what a great job his employees did and how good the food was! In a world where we are so quick to say something when people do something negative, we forgot to praise when people do a great job. Great job Jessica! We were so impressed!   Keep making great burgers and fries flipping burgers, and keep hiring good honest employees that provide great customer service!    Cheers!

X7W8OvPzRnDdrbswiNeP4g.text: Located on Fremont street this is probably one of the better and more fairly priced on Fremont. You can't miss this place at all.  Mainly they are known for their burgers fries and shakes. There are a good amount to choose from. I actually tried the mushroom philly which was vegetarian. Nice bun with mushrooms peppers and onions. We also got two shakes and some onion rings.   The shake was good but when they say medium you think it'll be bigger than what I got. I was let down by the size of the shake. They don't even show you the sizes so I regret that choice  Kiara (I think that was her name) was either new, not fully trained or just didn't wana be there. No smile at all, her voice said I don't want to be here. She didn't know how to ring in things and took 3 people to complete our order, one being a cook.... Yes let that sink in....the cook was helping the cashier...  The manager was there and yet not doing anything to help speed up this transaction. She didn't even notice our burgers took over 15 minutes to make with no one else inside...as a manager you have to be aware of your guests and ticket times.  Place is clean for sure.   Would I come back? If I was down town and wanted a burger for cheap yes I would. With all the restaurants surrounding I can go somewhere else and get my stuff faster and be around employees who want to work where they are!

b_060c2PNUWmP8XbtBxR7Q.text: Used to be an excellent place.  Now with recent lazy and inefficient staff has become an unsatisfactory place to dine.  The burgers are good but the staff are unpleasant and disrespectful.  The music is frequently too loud; the servers are often sarcastic and nasty.  Good burger.  Horrible service.  If you want to deal with heartburn after a good burger, this is the place for you.  I will not be going back. Spoke with the manager who is out of touch with how rude her new hired servers and bar staff are, she needs to fire most of them.  I was a regular, from the beginning of the business, and a big tipper: I am never going back, nor will I recommend this place to my friends going forward.  I am a Vegas and Downtown local.

IrXWNivbqNQJvzvc4slxvg.text: So I went again December 27th. Still amazing. So delicious. The Vegas heat was a little much in terms of heat to flavor that I like but I can see it being a very solid contender for the go to if my heat tolerance goes up. Also had the strawberry fields (I think) drink and it was very delicious.  Basically this is solidified in my opinion to be a "you have to go here if you're around Fremont Street" establishment. Delicious and kudos!

gQtQmCDivX8diTM5FXB9mQ.text: Walking downtown Vegas with an empty stomach at midnight made me look up something good to eat, so I came across this burger place (on Yelp)! and their amazing reviews.   I ordered the Nashville Chicken Sandwich and it was delicious ! I always share my plate with my boyfriend because I don't eat a lot and it was perfect size when cut in half!!! The chicken was juicy and delicious ! The buns were soft yet perfect!   I added some fries to my order and ordered a draft beer and that was enough for me ! My sister ordered the chicken tenders and loved them!  Everything was delicious and my boyfriend and sister were satisfied with both the food/drinks and the service!! Everyone was super nice and we got our food promptly.   The restrooms were nice and clean. It's a restaurant/bar and they have plenty of Tvs to entertain you while you eat.  Music was upbeat and perfect for Saturday night!!   I visit Vegas 3 times a year and I'm always looking for good food spots! So When I'm in Vegas again I will come back !!! All the way from Long Beach!!  Sorry no pictures we were starving and forgot to capture our food moment !!!  Also check in for a sweet discount!!!

1zYAvenUWvV6WOLOEnBAeg.text: My wife and I were on Fremont Street in Las Vegas on a Tuesday afternoon and we were in search of some cool places to go for happy hour. We walked by Flippin' Good and saw a sandwich board advertising their happy hour insinuating great deals so we decided to check it out.  When we sat down at the bar, we asked the bartender what their happy hour deals were. He said that we could get a Bud Light for $3, a Coors Light for $3, or we could get half of each mixed together for $3. He then proceeded to laugh at his own joke (I'm using the term loosely here) for a solid ten seconds. Those happy hour deals sounded pretty lame to us so we decided to just order some chicken bites. A few minutes later though, he came back saying that he "spoke with his manager" and that he could offer a deal that basically amounted to $2-3 off of any beer. This was a much better deal although I'm not sure why we had to go through the whole rigamarole.   We tried a flight of local Las Vegas beers and a plate of chicken bites which were accompanied by buffalo and cluckin' sauce. The chicken was tasty and both of the sauces added a nice amount of spice to the chicken. The flight offered a diverse array of beers: a pale ale, amber ale, lager, and a double IPA. None of the beers were super impressive, but maybe Las Vegas just doesn't have much of a craft beer scene yet.   Overall, the chicken was pretty good. The happy hour negotiation was weird. Not sure if we would come back.

xxf7nIClygmFvJf0DWf_gQ.text: I would say this place is family friendly since they have some booths and tables separated from the bar area. Menu is burgers, chicken, and shakes. Burgers with fried egg, bacon, Nashville style chicken - good stuff! Shakes options are good. Great service from everyone!

6kddUWi04ZCsfdwoShBdHw.text: The food here was good, the chicken sandwich was cooked well but the spice was overkill. It was the most unenjoyable experience. Our server originally recommended the flippin to which we felt like would be too spicy - even though we love spicy foods. We opted for Vegas and holy sh** I wanted to die. It's not that the spice itself was too much but it was the sheer amount that choked you up.   Staff can forsure do a better job here explaining the flavors to better inform guests. Also, didn't appreciate after our meal, the server Saul telling us he likes to get people to order the flippin just to watch them suffer.  Meals are suppose to be good and fill you up. I ended up taking 3 bites of my food - dying and filling up on ranch fries.

zyhpRXK1pHyu0e2zd7ZS1g.text: In the neighborhood today for the MLK parade.  Looking for Simple American food. I was literally 0.3 miles from the this place. Parking around the corner was very handy.  Greeted nicely by the young lady.  My buddy and I both ordered the same burger, and large fries to share.  The burger  is under $7.00.  Everything was really good.  My waitress was awesome too. I want to come back and get the fried chicken sandwich, but have the BUFFALO seasonings on it..  They did have country western music in here, but we were so much into the food! Excellent place to come.  Kinda small place, but they do have a bar.  It's cute. Us locals like deals too.

PaRuaA25X6-RaDUfbGN8oA.text: i've been coming here for years since before it was remodeled & the food has always tasted amazing! this place is clean with great food at a great price especially for dtlv. i give this place five stars but the only reason i have it at one, is because i cannot believe the disrespect of ordering a two piece tender meal & getting THIS. one chicken tender, & a little nub??? the nub was barely two inches (on the left). i wonder how whoever was in the kitchen looked at this & really thought that this was okay. i was very upset & shocked that i was really handed this. it got fixed but i wanna bring attention to this to the owner because i felt disrespected & ripped off. i will definitely come back as i have for years but this was just wrong.

crwB_JvRPQEYyh6tt1ozHw.text: Decent burgers but a bit on the dry side. The burgers here are made of 100% USDA lean angus beef. How lean? It didn't really occur to me to ask until I started writing this review. The flippin fries are like in and out's animal style fries. The fries themselves were on the soggy side which I didn't enjoy. However, I actually thought the flippin sauce was better than the spread on the animal fries. With that said, in and out fries are still way better. Go for the onion rings instead. They were so on point! Real talk, I'd go back just for the onion rings.

d6H5MoFYmj-RbCRWaKINMQ.text: Flippin' Good is a flippin' cheap option for Fremont Street eats- two can easily dine under $20, and that's with a side and dessert to share! I was excited about this spot opening but hesitant to visit given the generally-underwhelmed reviews, but their claims of freshness eventually tempted me through the door.   BURGERS: The menu lists single- and double-burgers for each style, I opted for the classic and realized why. The patty thickness is somewhere between White Castle and Dollar Menu Double. Props for offering a lettuce-wrapped version. Beef quality, like all the other reviews, lends itself to a less-favorable comparison to that West coast chain. The turkey burger retained a surprising juiciness and the toppings were fresh. FRIES: The regular variety are lightly salted, but if your a fan of spice, opt for the Flippin' Spicy style. I openly admit that these were WAY too spicy for me, with tons of chopped grilled jalapenos in every nook and cranny. These were perfectly topped too: so much cheese and pepper that it was difficult to find bare fries, even at the bottom. A win for most people, a lose for me, because it rendered the dish inedible, but this is entirely my fault. CONCRETE:  A few specialty versions for a sweet dessert treat, BF opted for the Brownie Delight, whose chocolaty tones were reminiscent of a Frosty, in a good way. The 10oz small is just the right size and the bits of brownie blended in added a nice texture that didn't take away from the overall creaminess.  Service was quick and cheery, space is clean and welcoming with framed, mirrored windows on the walls lending a farm-house feeling. This is a nice addition to the area given their relatively low price point and the fact that they deliver on their promised freshness. But it's not the kind of meal I'll cross town for, nor one I can justify paying a parking fee to access due to the location. Outside of the downtown area, I'd probably be more inclined to give them another try.

Fi1sZRt3pQfGUVeo9kdUwg.text: I can't stop thinking about their Nashville hot chicken sandwich! The breading they used is different from any breaded chicken I've had. The heat level I chose was "Vegas Hot" and boy, was it hot! With just the right amount of sweetness. I paired that with the Fire Fries which is topped with cheese and A LOT of jalapenos. There is also this honey chipotle sauce that is AMAZING! It's very sweet and not that hot. I'm pretty sure we used up almost half the bottle by the time we were done.

J1C3rkIqwC3xFu42aG1rsg.text: Tasty Nashville Chicken Sandwich I had, customer service was excellent and food wait time was not so long will be coming back to try more i teams on the menu for sure!

j3x_0NKu98ZDxnDbVTI_zw.text: This place was amazing. It offered a fresh retreat from the downtown norm with a diner look and burgers that rivaled in n out. Ever since it switched management, the focus is less on the food and more on making it look like a country dive bar. The pieces were raised, the quality was lowered and the sports are turned up to an 11. They switched the black and white tiles of a diner for trashy brick and steel to look like every other place in dtlv. It looks like a college bar now; not a welcome addition to Fremont Street.   The waiters and wait staff are rude, the tables are dirty and the food takes forever. I miss the old Flippin. :(  Update: currently eating here. Waiter is mad at us for some reason. Just dropped off straws and our drinks after 20 minutes. Straws are opened and stepped on, thanks guy!

ycKS5RughDSHTPyz-6QkjA.text: I had a burger and my wife had the very crispy chicken tenders. Both very good. Milkshake was thick and delicious. Chili cheese fries were amazing. Service was excellent

-RQxfkPDtpzGOegQrwqwkA.text: I can't rave enough of how delicious this place is. The chicken is light and fluffy and the Sweet Tea is amazing. Brings back so many memories from a trip to Nashville, TN.  The server was very friendly and when we asked questions he knew exactly what he was talking about. My first time was a hit and I look forward to going back!

CfMQKw42fEtqJYUP2C8x7A.text: We stumbled upon this joint after our target restaurant next door was closed.  Hubby had the Dirty Chicken - it was ok, nothing amazing. He also had a beer flight. Cute glasses. First Son had a Farm Burger that disappeared before I took a bite of my food - he enjoyed it!  Other son had a Bacon - he enjoyed it and gave it a solid 5. I had the chicken strips, I was nervous after reading a few reviews here. I shouldn't have been - the chicken was tender and the breading was perfect!  I also had a Daisy Duke (drink) - that I would skip it was very watered down and zero fizz (was supposed to have cream soda). The waitress was attentive (especially so given she was the only waitress working).  The joint was empty except one other table when we arrived and about half full by the time we left.

L-qs563RqLIp6KRE9ZK0nA.text: Great place. I was here a year or ago before it had its remodel. The food is still literally Flippin good but the serve has gone Flippin down. When it was the diner looking spot, the staff was friendly, there was smiles, it was welcoming. Now the bar spot, although more modern and in the tune of neighboring spots....just seems weird. It's an off vibe. We were seated and just saw the wait staff doing their normal routine as if no one new was seated. No nods of hello, no mention of "be right to you", not even the occasional glance in the customer's direction. Seemed very weird. Once the waiter came who is also a bartender things went ok I guess. The order was correct and it tasted good but that's it. Nothing is memorable or keeps me returning but the food. Customer service can definitely take the same renovation effort as the stylish change. We had the impossible burger ( a vegan's dream) and the farm burger (carnivore dream). Flippin amazing but we also had blah service. Imma be back though.

xHkddu2CEfIZWI--MpWaIA.text: I didn't like my cheese fries, but liked the fried pickles. Had to stop eating them because my entire table realized it smelled like a barnyard. Literally like a goat was in my face.

SLlJ2b8Dqb-z0zzAAsj9GA.text: I tried their chicken and it didn't taste great at all, in fact I sent it back. It tasted like cheap quality chicken. They gave me a burger in exchange which was dripping from grease and tasted like a frozen patty. Their fried pickles had way too much batter on them and weren't great either.   If it was not for their milk shake I'd give this place a 1 star. Their milk shakes are the best I've ever had. If this were a milkshake joint they'd receive a 5 star. However I don't recommend their root beer floats as they aren't floats, the ice cream is blended with the soda into a shake and is not a True float. It basically tasted like root beer flavored ice cream.

5nqbZ8zWVighpvns67eDBQ.text: Their food is absolutely amazing. Prices are very reasonable and you get a good amount of food. Took away one star only because service was slow. The establishment isn't big but nice and cozy and wasn't full so not sure why there was such a s delay with getting our food to us. The server we had was very informative and gave us recommendations on what to try as well as different information regarding things in the area the restaurant is not in the hustle and bustle of Fremont area that gets super co heated which is great because it's a quick in and out if needed. Also taxis line up right outside of this restaurant so it's great to do everything you want to and the. Come here to eat if you're catching a cab back to another area.

kHxb68KvigUAgFMJOqFiEQ.text: Limited menu but good food. Fried chicken sandwiches and burgers. A couple of salad options. Fries were excellent. Great location. There was a #vegan option.

t9mMo0N6fY5AbYVkVWoiGg.text: I went to Flippin' Good with my co-workers for lunch to celebrate one of the co-workers Birthday.  Things I loved: There are many big screens TV on all three side of walls. We went there during a World Cup game so it was perfect. I was able to watch the whole 1st half.  The Nashville Hot Chicken sandwich was delicious. The chicken was very crispy and the spiciness was right on. It had a strong heat but not tongue burning; I ordered the Vegas spicy level. I have friends that ordered the hottest level and they all said it was really hot and both of them can eat pretty spicy. Choose your spicy level wisely.  Things I liked: The ambiance was fine; it was clean and bright. Service was solid; our server was friendly and all orders came out okay.  It's a nice place for a quick lunch. I definitely will come back again.

Hl0Cr3uKfAcIam6emdnDlw.text: Maybe it's because we ordered from postmates but this food was horrible! I don't ever mind my food being cold when i use postmates but the fries I ordered tasted stale. Worst part was I ordered the super spicy chicken burger and super spicy fries. I can handle spice and love when things are spicy. The flavor on both were not good at all. I hated the flavor no matter how bad I wanted to love it. It looked amazing in the pics on Instagram I saw but when I tried them it fell short

OsW3Oj2whLNiCKmAtR7j8Q.text: 3.5-4 stars. Flippin' Good lives up to it's namesake, but it's not flippin' great.   The space was smaller than I expected from walking by it a handful of times, but not cramped. They have plenty of TVs for sports and a decent sized bar.   I tried the Nashville hot chicken sandwich with fries. The chicken was breaded and seasoned well, but the meat was a little dry and bland. The fries were the best part for me! Freshly made and on the thicker side, which is usually not my preference.   Service is good, but unfortunately on my visit there was an employee walking around the floor doing basically nothing but eating...and drinking. Taking a premixed shot was the first thing she did after stepping on the floor. Super uncool from a health-code standard and it's what drags this review down from a solid 4 stars.   If I was in the downtown area and needed a meal, I'd consider it, but won't be making a point to come back any time soon.

uEJ9dFPvoWJzckBNySfDlw.text: French fries were soggy and all the crust fell off the chicken. Taste of sandwich overall was okay but would never eat here again.

InrY0_T_vCfSuyehb9bzNw.text: I was staying at the Four Queens down Fremont and was looking for a burger downtown. A place without the fan fare of the Heart Attack Grill. Right across the street was a locals hangout called Flippin Good Chicken and Burgers. I got there at 11:45 . I ordered the old fashioned which came with fries. It arrived quickly.  Excellent burger and delicious fries. Huge portion I might add. It was $10.95 for the burger and the fries.  I'll be back next time to try the chicken sandwich.

kFdxP6DBbXiIllXlKIWxaQ.text: This place is pretty yummy. I've been here on several occasions and this is the first time I review them. I'm not rating them overall, I'm just rating their vegan burger because that's the only thing I've had since they changed their menu.   Personally the vegan burger is usually good however this last time I did notice the bread was very dry and it literally crumbled when I bit into it plus the burger was just dry. I know this isn't always the case but I was very taken back because usually their food is on point. I ordered  their onion rings and those never fail. They're always very crunchy, the flavor is all in the batter and they've always been consistent. Like I said today I'm just ranting about the Vegan burger because I was a bit disappointed since I could've just gone somewhere else to have a solid vegan burger.

K1SONh1gZf5puPnN2PKI4Q.text: Came here for the opening years ago and it was great. Perfect fries.   Came here 2 weeks ago and they certainly changed! The onion rings are to die for. I had 2 servings and leftovers the next day. They are crispy yet soft. The crisp didn't have that burnt oil flavor! Not too greasy or soggy. Superb flavor!  Fries are great! Everything cooked in house, NOT FROZEN!   Burgers are flavorful and filling. You get your money worth. Such an inexpensive gem! Can't wait to come back. ....again and again!

oNwzup0bZQIgMQTZzTjoTA.text: Best burger in Nevada, possibly the world. Even the fries were wonderful. Cold beer and great food. Our waiter Bill was awesome. We will be stopping here every time we visit Vegas!

Qao5PokJwSrc6pblXGDfGg.text: This place is BOMB.  I'm now even embarrassed to say that when my cousin (who's a local) suggested this spot, my first thought was "Did we really come all the way here for chicken sandwiches?" Well, this was the best chicken sandwich I've ever had hands down. I got the Nashville with Nashville level heat & it packed a punch. The chicken itself is cooked perfectly and the breading basically melts in your mouth. Not thick or cakey at all! I didn't even notice the sweet pickles with the spice of the sandwich, it all just went together so well!  Definitely a must next time we're visiting again!

6_lwOXLnsHm2kV-VcvxJZA.text: My husband and I love coming the day time bartender Bill is awesome! Super friendly, always accommodating!!  We come here just for him!!!!

A3EUexFuCTOmhqzkVuuo0g.text: It was super late coming, thanks GrubHub. The fries were cold and didn't taste good. The burger was covered in soooooo much condiment gloop that's all I could taste. It made the bun slip right if the burger, or is it the burger slipped right off the bun?  Either way, it was not fun eating. After most of the mayo, ketchup and mustard fell on my shirt, lap and couch.... and covered my fingers, I was over this meal. Ended up using a fork and knife to eat it. Lame. And threw away the top bun that was soggy form the condiments.  It should be spread on the bun, not 2 tablespoon dollops of each on the bun. So inedible. I did get the salad with fried chicken pieces that was actually really good.  But other than that ... not my favorite place to get a burger. Ask for toppings on the side. And maybe just eat if there so the fries are fresh. When you put them in those cardboard containers that are lined with wax sealant inside, the food steams and the moisture then makes everting soggy, especially the fries. And it was cold out, so when the driver brought it, it was just in a bag, and not a warming carrier tote. It should be mandatory that they all have access or ability to have a hot and cold carrier. Depending on what you order.

m_K6mFfSGb5QmbkO3ZlUFw.text: I would call Flippin Good Burgers Flippin Humdrum.  I found it to be little more than a middle of the road fast food joint with a nice dining room and trendy location.  The fare definitely did not wow.  In my opinion, In n Out's flavors are superior.    We got the Bacon Cheeseburger, Grilled Chicken Sandwich, Onion Rings, & Flippin Fries, with Huckleberry and Pumpkin Pie milkshakes.  The Cheeseburger and Chicken were bland & overly greasy on stale buns, and the onion rings were overcooked.  The shakes were cloyingly sweet and artificial tasting.  Overall, we just did not enjoy the items we purchased at Flippin Good, but the space itself is very nice and clean for a fast food restaurant.

gQEyIh6B1T7Wq61fbAnNYw.text: Can this be, a close rival to In-N-Out?!? Of course not, nothing can ever take the place of my beloved In-N-Out,  but this place is still really good. They used to have a 20% off Yelp check-in, but the last time I was there  I didn't see it up on the page.  The menu has various burger, chicken sandwiches, fries, onion rings, and vegetarian options. If you have room then definitely indulge in one of their sinfully epic ice cream treats. I usually go for the flippin' cheeseburger with flippin' fries (their version of animal style fries) and a beer. Everything is made to order and comes out freshly delicious. This place is definitely better than nasty Shake Shack on the Strip. Overall, if you're in Downtown Las Vegas and are craving some burgers then make this place a spot to check out.

QoUrdIBCw-H6dkLwneWmKw.text: We came here to try the vegan "chicken" sandwich. And the food was so good! We sat outside while the sun was going down, ordered drinks, and stayed a while. The service was awesome! It was a big group of us. And they were so helpful and patient with the bill situation. Thank you for offering vegan items on the menu!!!! Definitely recommend!

-JanAPWE-TfmTyfLApQbXQ.text: My favorite chicken spot! Spicy, light, & crispy. Onion rings & fries perfectly fried. Drinks were awesome and outstanding service. A HUGE thank you to Alexander & the manager!

fceDetbk8ojj_q5Bq9_6MA.text: I work downtown and was excited to try their nashville chicken. The first time i tried to just out an order to go was superbowl sunday and they told me I could not do so because they were too busy.  Today i called ay 10:58....Bill answered the phone....I told him I would like to place a to go order....he said "We are not open...call back in 2 minutes".  I have worked in the restaurant industry for over 20 years.....2 minutes.....seriously. I wasnt going to call back and give them another chance but I did. I regret that decision. I ended up getting the nashville hot chicken and fries even though i said i did not want fries.......the sandwich was incredibly dry and there was nothing nashville hot about it.....the fries were old and cold... How can that be when they just opened. I dont think I will be giving them another chance and i work close to them....they could have made me a loyal regular but they blew it.

4hu-xbcnula8kCmFVMbskQ.text: As others have stated: Five Guys has a kid with In-N-Out. This is that kid. So, you get good burgers, good fries, and some shakes all served in a clean, open environment. It's not a sit-down type place with table cloths and what not, but if you're looking for a decent burger and fries (and maybe a shake?) then this'll do ya.  If I'm not mistaken they do serve beer as well, so this could serve as a burger-and-beer spot without the character of a more pricey, wood-paneled type place. Service was good when I was here, but I don't expect much from these types of restaurants. They took the order, and brought the food out when it was ready. Win-win.

jBcKndIYps8AcOQ00j9Lwg.text: Flippin' average. Ordered a grill chicken burger and the texture of the chicken was almost like plastic or imitation chicken. Had a side of chili cheese fries, the cheese wasn't even melted on top and it tasted like tomato sauce fries pretty much. My boyfriend ordered a spicy chicken sandwich and it was just okay, he also had a lemonade that tasted like tap water. Overall, the server was amazing, hispanic girl, name started with a "V" , very sweet!! She literally was the only good thing about this place, for almost $30 it wasn't worth the price and I don't think i'll come back. Also, given the location I understand there will be drunk people but there were two overly loud groups who kept bumping into chairs and one guy was humping another person. Very distracting when you just want to eat but again it's downtown so can't do much about that I guess.

3WcHJUmoeuiyZACaXcJQqQ.text: Went in on my lunch break and TRIED to order food to go and was directed over to the bar.   I'm waiting there for 10 minutes and the bartender fails to acknowledge me but seems to service everyone else sitting on both sides of me. It was even a new couple who came up to the bar and she took their orders immediately.   At this point I'm annoyed and just walk out... went to container park instead. A simple "Hi, I'll be with you in a moment" would have been nice. But I got completely ignored.   I heard good reviews about the this place from my coworkers. The food must be good but the service sucks. It's sad because I really was craving a burger... Can't wait to bring this one up in my hospitality class.

w_wU7SQ3WsmsydewU9X9jQ.text: My favorite please to grab a fresh bite to eat downtown. I love the causal setting. Best vegan chicken sandwich in town and I love their onion rings and fried pickles! Mike always takes good care of my friends and family.

qRABks-uYIFJPSiXPdrUrA.text: Had the bacon burger combo. It was very good. Also had bacon queso fries and Nashville fried pickles. All were excellent. Heater was very sweet and provided great service at the bar. Love the atmosphere! Beers at 8 to $10 a piece is a little steep. The beer was very good but not that good! I I will go back for their food though.

4VveOkWBcbsS3Z9AJ0Vlng.text: This place is awesome! I still stand by my first review. While I was out last night having fun on Fremont Experience after some shots and cocktails and dancing, I was starving! Usually by midnight all the vegan spots I know are far and closed. But thank god for flipping good chicken they're open until 2 am! The hostess was so nice outside the door as she went to seat us. Our server came out immediately with ice water which I needed desperately haha and took our order and recommended a alcoholic beverage called a Tennessee tea that was super yummy! We didn't wait long for our food to come out and while we waited they had good music playing, a little Carrie Underwood and Blake Shelton it gave a nice modern country vibes.. Our food was delish like always never any complaints it always stays consistent which is another plus! This place is seriously a must try if your a vegan or carnivore there's something for everyone and yummy cocktails, beers. I will be back again soon! If I'm not in the area they also offer Postmates so I don't even have to leave the house to get a yummy vegan chicken burger..

u4upWC7alzrj1a4GE2Bxnw.text: We've been here a couple times and the food, service and atmosphere have been above average but not quite 5 stars. I'd give 4.5 if I could. The process are also very fair, and the free beer for checking in is a nice bonus. Bill took very good care of us for our visit tonight, he'd get 5 stars if I could rate him. Thanks!

IqptoTGKTCbsOEiMf6o9qQ.text: Incredible vegan fried chicken sandwich. It was insanely delicious. You couldn't tell whether you were eating real chicken or not it was so unbelievable. We were taking a walk down Fremont and my husband was dying to try this. No regrets. Service was kind and food was quick to prepare.

svzNInhsy1Lup1fvabbbtg.text: Since the remodel the only vegetarian / vegan option they have is a vegan Chick'n sandwich, which they didn't have when I went. I'm not sure why they didn't have it or when they plan on getting it. I asked if they had anything else vegetarian and they said no. Their website has a banner on the front page which proclaims "keepin' it vegetarian" advertising the Garden Burger and Portobello Philly. They've apparently removed these options from the menu.   I would strongly advise management to at least bring the garden burger patty back to give veggie people an option. Also, the new beer selection is lame, all lagers and IPAs and domestics.   This is super disappointing but I guess I won't be eating here anymore.

ugZtfopY-LQdNicVZlKRGw.text: What could be considered my LIB HQ, I had quite a few meals at Flippin' Good last weekend. My order was always a double turkey burger (extra pickles, mustard), a side of fries and a water. Total: $7.xx. I know you can find some cheap eats on Freemont, but anytime you can REALLY stuff yourself for under $8, I'm a fan. As for the food itself, it wasn't half bad. Like others have mentioned, it's a step above a McD's, but probably a step down from a BurgerFi or Smashburger. Much respect for having a potato bun, 'merican cheese, fresh veggies (which you can ask them to pile on) and a legit sized patty. The Flippin Sauce on the burg' is no Animal Style from I&O or Mac Sauce, but it's not the worst. Bottom line, when intoxicated or in need of a relatively quick and inexpensive meal, this place isn't a bad place to be. Coat that stomach and rage on!   Note: it takes 7-10 minutes to get your order. Prepare for that.

photos.caption: Photo of Flippin' Good Chicken, Burgers, Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double turkey burger extra pickles
Photo of Flippin' Good Chicken, Burgers, Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger and fries

XzE4WcHCC69-MgreD_FJyQ.text: Came here for a late lunch. This is right across from Fremont Street in the east side of Downtown.   I got a mango iced tea which is really good on a warm day. I went with the bacon cheeseburger single meat patty with cheese fries. The burger was descent. Reminds me of the other burger chain. Ahem. It was okay. The cheese fries were good. Drenched in cheese. The onion rings were crunchy and tasty. Pretty descent burgers. Food was about $30 including a milkshake my daughter got.   Once you order, you get a number and they bring you your food. The lady at the register was super nice and friendly. They also serve Coke products here. A plus in my book. There are plenty of tables to sit inside. Restaurant is cool and the best part is there is music playing from Justin Bieber to all the R&B hip hop music. I feel great vibes in here. Makes me want to dance. I am singing the words to Sorry by Justin Bieber. Love the music.

8FV9VXbBdb33AyQIA8p-fQ.text: We are Flippin' Virgins...this was our 1st visit here...we wanted to come here when they first opened their doors awhile back.  Today we visited around 1:30pm it wasn't too crowded for a Saturday. We walked in and was immediately given a warm welcome and nice smile.   We walked up to the counter to order our food and was immediately impressed with their staff that took our order. She was very friendly. We ordered a Flippin' Good Cheeseburger Double patty-$7.45 Bacon Cheeseburger single-5.95 Kids Grilled Cheese-$1.95 Flippin' Fries-$4.25 Onion Rings-$3.95 Fountain drink large-$2.65 x2 Brownie Delight-$4.25 Total tab-$35.80  The food came out fast and everything tastes delicious. Onion rings was very crunchy and fresh. Burgers were great tasting and fries was also delicious as well with the grilled onions and Flippin' sauce. The Cherry Coke was tasting awesome because it was set to the right syrup / Soda water setting. Brownie Delight was very delicious too.  We definitely will be back when we are in the downtown area and craving a great burger and milkshake.

BnM8-H9kbFvvVR6iR2AyRg.text: YUM!!! I had the burger, fries, and chocolate malt. My meal was about $20. The food was amazing. The burger was cooked just last medium. The fries were some of the best I've ever had. The malt was handmade and the perfect thickness.   The restaurant is located less than 1 block past the Fremont Street Experience. It's a bit small, but the space is utilized well.   The servers are just super nice! The added check-in bonus from Yelp is perfect. There is country music playing in the background and music videos are playing on one of the TV screens.   While it's a bit expensive, it's well worth the cost.

IPZYIAGADH7cCn58aC5Mzw.text: Gather round and read my digital yarn spun about a boy, booze, and a breaded chicken sandwich.  Fremont is an area blessed with an abundance of boutique bars, the liquor flows all too freely here, its the part of town that your liver would have nightmares about.  At some point as you stumble down this neon street of non sobriety chances are you'll come to following realization. "Christ, I'm wasted!!! I better eat something!" Yes. Yes you should. And what better to eat than a crispy chicken sandwich topped with everything a plastered patron needs to get back in the game.  What you need is something to sop up some of your bad decisions, what you need is the "Dirty Bird".   Cheese. Check Bacon. Check Egg. Check.  The holy trinity of hangover helpers atop a juicy, crispy slab of bird. Side of fries and you got yourself a downtowns most delicious second wind.  It's so good that one day I may just eat one sober.

5USrtNmn6fiPjPXJG6uIqg.text: Hostess seated the five of us. Waiter asks for all of our IDs. My daughter is not 21. Your problem for not asking to begin with if it's the "bar area". We need to relocate.  It's 60 degrees outside. We're seated not too far from the open front windows. We ask for the window to be shut and instead they want to turn up the heat. We leave. We enjoyed a wonderful dinner around the corner, without open windows. We walk by less than two hours later and the windows are shut...

qXSqkYly6X3KWOsAFJ5P9w.text: Very rude. Hostess picks and chooses who dines at their restaurant. The pickles were the only thing that were somewhat tasty.  Service was slow and we went mid day when the place was not packed at all and it truly felt like they could've cared less that we were even there. 5DC6oBH5mGYytPF6rI37ZA.text: One of the worst qualities a restaurant can have is a rude and bad manager and that is exactly what this restaurant has.   I went in last weekend with my boyfriend late at night and ordered two meals. Soon after after we ordered we noticed an employee went up to the front and started turning costumers away and letting them know that they would not be taking orders orders for another 20 min due to being super behind. This went on for a while so we decided to ask him why it was taking so long to get our food, he replied that the grill at the restaurant can only take so many burgers and that they couldn't make too many orders at a time.    We spent a while looking around at the same 6 people that were before us and they still did not have their food either. They had two different people pick orders to go (nothing too big) but the whole time the staff just talked, brought signs in from the outside and didn't seem concerned or stressed about the people waiting.   Let me just say that I've seen more of a hustle at McDonald's!!! I couldn't believe my mind. More than 30 min went by and we still didn't have our food so we decide to go to the manager at the front and ask for a refund because we were starving. The manager decided to reply "we told you it would be 15 min" my boyfriend then asked him to see what time the check was printed and he then realized that it had been over 30 min and said, "oh well your food is ready" my boyfriend told him off and reminded him that a "manager" should always apologize for making people wait for ridiculous amount of time for their "fast food" and never give a smart ass reply when being asked for a refund. He then realized his mistake and gave us our money back but with a side of attitude.   I can't see this place lasting long, if you can't handle a busy Fremont street or have good management with employees that move their feet then don't expect to succeed.   I'll never go back.

CjtOKW1Bz56VIyNlPUgTYw.text: The atmosphere and the service were great, and the food was good. Their signature sauce is a tangy kind of thousand island and I got an extra side for my fries. They had some interesting boozy shakes that looked tasty as well. I probably would have had one if the server hadn't brought our check, but I was pretty full from the burger and fries already anyway. If you're not a huge eater I would suggest sharing so you leave room for a shake. The only thing I would suggest is that they offer more than just American cheese on their burgers.

Gam8gfYalsHBAXerIVn9Kg.text: The redo of Flippin good is "Flippin' Good. They have totally redone the menu and I love the Farm Burger. It feels like a nice Burger Bar...not like a typical burger joint. Beers on tap and a great selection. Guineas and Tenaya Creek and more. If you haven't been....go and check out the redo. u_4IYNXoMfQcO2PAgb253g.text: A local recommended this place to us, and I'm glad we followed her advice. We stopped by for dinner after visiting The Mob Museum.  They have outdoor (2 large picnic tables) and indoor seating with plenty of TVs to watch sports on. We opted for outdoors since the weather was perfect!  Our waiter was friendly and came over right away. The items on the menu are very affordable, especially for a place on Freemont Street in Downtown Las Vegas.  We ordered the bacon burger with avocado and chili cheese fries. Despite being from Texas, where we love our Whataburger and meat, we genuinely enjoyed the burger. It was a perfect size and very flavorful. The patty itself is on the thin side (so get double meat if you're not easily satisfied) but with the bacon, aged cheddar, and avocado, it all comes together beautifully and is a True portion. The chili cheese fries were good too.  Overall, a tasty and affordable place in Downtown Las Vegas.

kqYBNxLfQ122QQOFWAjD6g.text: Wonderful food and wonderful service! Best chilli cheese fries I've ever had. Definitely coming back when I'm back in town.

p1Pmjo25--wtQNDjAsya_g.text: The food here is very good. They're priced a little higher than many burger counters, but the food is better and the location is prime so I get it.   I visited last night with a friend and the cashier, Rachelle, didn't accurately enter my order - for the third consecutive visit to this place. I ordered the farm burger, 2 patties with all of the toppings in a lettuce wrap - what I always order.   This time, I got a sad looking single patty with cheese, an egg and two pieces of bacon on it. Not what I ordered.   Luckily, Rachelle has great co workers who have fixed her mistakes each time and delivered a delicious final product. The management needs someone on the register to can communicate clearly and take orders with small modifications. With that fix, this place will definitely get a better rating from me.

XrHKpo-3O9q08YPanrvDXw.text: New favorite indulgence. Their vegan fried chik n sandwich is absolutely to die for!! Thick, juicy, and their delicious sauce is vegan as well! 100% satisfies my fried chicken cravings, and my man now asks to eat here at least once a week!

x2AsaMlE2UERLwEnM7rWPw.text: Let me tell you, I have never ever ever been in a burger joint where they mess up all three of our meals. I ordered the old fashion burger and I asked for no tomatoes but add pickles... brought it to my table and it was the total opposite, a full tomato and with no pickles! I was already bitter at that point. Another order that they messed up was my friend. He ordered the flippin' onion fries and when it came out NO ONIONS it was just cheese (not even good cheese) and fries! Now I am mad. Last ordered they messed up was my boyfriends. He ordered the farm burger and asked for no grilled onions and what do you know, IT CAME WITH GRILLED ONIONS! I was furious at that point, I just stopped eating and left. I mean, who messes up every single order when we asked for none of the above? The funny thing was, the family behind us also had there order messed up. There food wasn't that good anyways, I've had better. So, I do not recommend this place.. unless you want to see for yourself.

hp-YxKtdkhlSHhLlI44bCw.text: Quick Look - Going to be a "Fast Food" or "Fast Casual" game changer in Downtown, Las Vegas. Quality establishment with some tasty burgers, fresh potato French-fries and real ice cream milk shakes / custard "concrete" deserts. Did I mention draft beers too?   Was there for the "soft opening" today and they knocked it out of the park. Bright white decor throughout - might be an issue keeping clean in the future? Right now it works, and the inside looks great. They have rock music playing over the speakers and a giant 70 inch high definition TV on the wall. The menu consist of burgers. Some with bacon, some with jalapenos, some with all of the above (and then some). You can order them as single or double patties. They even have a turkey burger on the menu. The French-fries are delicious and come from fresh cut potatoes.   I spoke with management and they have plans to stay open until 3am on busy weekend nights / mornings. I expect their late night traffic will be strong with the busy nightlife next-door. Burger combo with a large fries and drink cost about $13. Personally, this is what Downtown needed. I think they are going to succeed in this location and I wish them success with this new restaurant.   Without hesitation that I recommend Flippin' Good Burgers and Shakes. Good people, and good food.

gvq_Qpyt5dGOw18eA2lBwA.text: I really enjoy this place. The interior design is modern, hip, and simple. A well kept lobby and very clean environment. The Inside is big and spacious easily able to sit the late night rush and/or the drunk crowds. They have a huge ultra HD TV hanging in the middle wall playing mordern/today's popular music videos.  Double Farm Burger (fried egg, grilled onion, smoked bacon, ketchup and melted american cheese) with Onion Rings and regular 16oz Martin & Lewis (vanilla milkshake) came to the total of $14.75. The price is ok but if you only get the burger and onion rings, the amount would be around $10. The prices of the burgers, fries, onion rings are pretty standard but the quality of the food is delicious.  The onions rings are thick cut, well battered and perfectly fried. Everytime I took a bite, it made a wonderful crunch and the onion itself stayed intact with the fried exterior. Nothing is more disappointing when the onion itself is not intact with the fried exterior. The burger is really good, reminds of Steak n Shake and I love Steak n Shake. The vanilla milkshake was delicious as well but Is it a $5 milkshake? Overall a great burger joint in downtown Las Vegas.

8Lw9uE6Xa0BHbRjef1cvfw.text: I'm updating my review from three stars to four based on my most recent visit to Flippin' Good in downtown Las Vegas. On my first visit, I was extremely excited to visit Flippin' Good because I'd been looking for an old fashioned burger and custard place here in Vegas. The store is very nice on the inside, with wide booths and evenly spaced tables, a small counter area with bar stools, and a large flatscreen TV. The outside looks a little hastily painted (as the door handles are already chipping) but it's still very presentable and attractive.   One of the best qualities of this restaurant is how amazingly CLEAN everything is (a rarity for eateries on Fremont Street). If the employees aren't taking orders or cooking food, they are going around wiping down tables and mopping the floors.   I had to wait momentarily to place my order as all employees were busy, but the employee who came over apologized sincerely for my wait and patiently took my order. She made sure to carefully make adjustments to my husband's burger (no toppings beside the bacon and cheese), and asked us to make sure that the order on the screen was correct. She had accidentally punched in a 2-patty turkey burger for me but quickly changed it to 1 when I pointed it out.  Be prepared to wait a little bit for your food (approximately 7-8 minutes), but that's because everything is made fresh and piping hot! My husband LOVED his bacon cheeseburger, and while I enjoyed the fresh toppings and homemade bun, my turkey burger was extremely salty. I'll probably just stick with a regular beef burger next time.   I went back up to the counter and order a brownie concrete (and added banana for 50 cents). At first the concrete was hard to eat (the lid isn't large enough for a spoon to fit through, and the overflow of concrete spilled out onto the counter when I took the lid off), but the combination of brownies, banana, and smooth custard was BOMB!   I'm sure my husband and I will visit again soon.

Once we arrived we were told they had just changed their menu so items we went for were no longer available. Was told they were trying to be more of "chicken" place. Decided to go ahead and try it.....and was quickly disappointed.  Ice tea was awful and tasted like instant tea in a jar. Ordered chicken bites with the flipping good sauce. Chicken was nothing spectacular but wasn't bad. The flipping good sauce had a good flavor. Decided to try the fire fries as we both enjoy spicy food....this however was a huge disappointment. It was such an awful flavor we literally only ate 2-3 fries each. Hubby also ordered a Boulevard that he said tasted like it was bad. Waiter walked passed and we tried to stop him numerous times but he kept going. Finally got him to stop so we could order a different drink. Waiter never even asked if something was wrong and when we attempted to say something he walked off. Then after 15-20 min he walks passed and slams down the new drink. Tried to get him to stop several more times to see about getting more flipping good sauce but he was more interested in watching tv. When he finally came by we were able to get him to stop, tried to ask for more sauce and tried to advise him that the fries were terrible. He shrugged his shoulders and walked off. Then after waiting another 15 plus minutes we had to ask the lady up front who seats you, if we could pay our bill. She advised us the server has to take care of it. After her trying to get the waiters attention, she too gave up and got a lady from the back (guessing manager/owner) to ring us up and cash us out. Terrible service and overall not great food for the price. Definitely won't recommend or return.

Absolutely LOVE places like these. Places where they put their customers first!! Now they just need to add it to the menu!!!!

bW8LNn--VJsUF6vGhNgH9Q.text: Yes it's basically a fast food restaurant, but it's clean, fresh and the staff is outstanding! Gomer and I stopped by because we saw a sign board out front advertising Huckleberry shakes and we can't pass up a good huckleberry product! We were met by a very friendly young man named John that gave us the run down on the vittles! Fresh handcut fries, never frozen and real ice cream shakes. We ordered the old fashioned double burger! The bun was soft, and toasted perfectly. The patties were not very large but had great flavor as did the toppings! The fries were hot and crispy! Our milk shakes were creamy and delicious! Overall we are completely satisfied with Flippin Good Burgers. Is this a gourmet burger joint... No.... But it's very clean, the food was very tasty and every one of the employees was friendly, pleasant and helpful!

0fiE1OUjR1OtaOldd5n9_Q.text: My first impression of this place actually exceeded my expectations. Unlike many downtown places, this is quite big and roomy. I'm a fan of thicker, more potatoey fries, so theirs hit the spot for me. I'm happy that as a downtown resident, I won't have to drive out of the neighborhood for a good fast food burger and fries. Xm8w0X-6GkLHX2R_QUbuYA.text: Flippin' Good is truly Flippin' Good! They are my go to place for burgers. They fell in love and keep asking when they are opening a location in Northern California? If you are in downtown Las Vegas go eat at Flipping Good! Go now! The only thing I will say that is somewhat a negative, is that when they first opened they had sliders and they were so good! They no longer have then on the menu. If you do go to Flippin' Good, please get a shake and/or a concrete (frozen custard), they are so good creamy and the chocolate is the best!!

-2bIioDar0lv16TwnzTyBg.text: Awesome place!!! Great customer service,food is great. If you like eggs and bacon the farm burger, You feel like eating your veggies the portobello philly, and you want something light the grilled cheese. For the sides the chilly cheese fries, or onion rings.

hckGg4ivSPwBw4dKNvCJfQ.text: Literally eating here right now and had to write this...the burgers are amazing and fries are too!!! Definitely recommend!!!

B7CILtFZfhe_1VBskJHKVQ.text: One of the best burger places I've been too. It was fresh and filled with flavor. The sauce was an amazing touch to the burger. My boyfriend had the chicken with the honey spice sauce that's on the tables and was obsessed. Definitely will be returning to try a shake!!

6wikaPh67ubtaNR-RzaEZA.text: I've only had the chance to try the kids grilled cheese and the cheese fries and the cheese fries were so good that even if the grilled cheese tasted like garbage, I'd still come back so I could get some cheese fries. They're natural cut fries and I think it's sliced cheese on top? Idk but I want more of them in my mouth.

pT44ydiHyy768rwEJcR6Pw.text: If you want your food, make sure you are on top of it, I never received mine. I told an employee about it but after 10 minutes of nothing, I went to the counter to cancel my order. The employee grabbed the Manager and all he did was ask if I wa ted to cancel il and did just that. He told me to hold on, and grabbed a $5 off coupon for my next order. He did not apologize or mention anything about my experience. If my friend, who ordered after I did, did not check up on his food (after my suggestion) he would not have gotten it either sinxe his food was sitting there with no idea of whefe it was heading.

mBgN8bzWmMA4Wn2LY5n-VA.text: This was a great spot to stop by after having a few drinks. Environment was very clean, staff was friend and accommodating. I got the Flippin' Good Burger with a side of fries. The burger was great, nothing extraordinary but really hit the spot for me. The fries were .. Okay. I don't know if I got the very last morsels but my fries were way too salty. They also tasted like they had been sitting out for a while. I do wish I had tried one of their milkshakes, the ones displayed looked amazing. In all, I wouldn't mind coming back, I just wouldn't go out of my way.

EVVZr2_qOrKgpB2o2zJMmw.text: Overall assessment is average. I'm cutting this place some slack since its brand new, so here's the review.   The place is very nice inside and the location is great, right on Fremont and LV Blvd. I stopped in for lunch and ordered the "Farm Burger" and fries.  The food came out quick, I would guess around 8 minutes after I ordered. The meat was very plain, just tasted like decent quality beef with no seasoning at all. The bun, while soft, was very greasy. I don't know what the shiny stuff is all over it, I'm assuming butter or oil to give it the shine. It made my hands greasy with every bite. See the picture in the review. I liked how the bun was soft on top but toasted on the grill as well. The egg was slightly over cooked and wasn't runny, the bacon not crispy but more rubbery. Grilled onions were just there as well, not much depth of flavor.   The fries were ok but I was hoping for a little more crunch than the soft ones I got. This preference so I'm not factoring it into the star rating. Very lightly salted, but also a preference thing.   I'm still trying to find what will make this burger place different from all the others. Nothing about the food stood out as better than any other burger spot. Because it wasn't the worst burger I've had, and it's a convenient lunch spot, I'll give it one more go. When I go back, I'm going to just try a plain burger to see if it's better than one with all the extras like the farm burger has. I will update the review afterward

photos.caption: Photo of Flippin' Good Chicken, Burgers, Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farm burger, single patty. Comes with a fried egg, bacon, grilled onions, cheese, and bbq sauce.

R7ZhIxY9kcLWxqQSxuJ-nw.text: Late & raining, we ran in here after I missed a food truck that's located across the street from here. So I was starving and knew I needed a meal, I figured a burger would hit the spot. IT DID!!! I ordered the farm burger. It had a fried egg, & bacon on it. OMG DELICIOUS!!!! It was pretty pricey, like $13, but damn was it good! So good I ordered another 1 to take back to my hotel room! Our server was pleasant, but disappeared a few times,  not quite sure what that was all about, but I'll definitely go back when I'm in town.

nRRfT3aX08cnCPANWXZh3g.text: Ok so look at that big ass piece of chicken in the photo I attached to this review. Holy cow, or shall I say holy chicken! That freaking thing was massive! You know how you normally have bread left and run out of meat? Well no not the case here. I ran outta bread before I could finish the chicken! That sandwich had to have been the best Nashville fried chicken sandwich ever. It was juicy, spicy, and just had the best flavors.   The service was excellent. We got our order in, drinks served, and order delivered in a timely manner. We went on a Thursday during the late afternoon. It wasn't too busy. It was nice and air conditioned too. There were plenty of tvs and a nice long bar up at the front of the restaurant. It's in the newly renovated downtown section of Fremont street. Definitely worth a bite to eat here.

py200t3QqWA9GyjJ9L283g.text: I had a great experience here a couple weeks ago when I was downtown for a concert. I was thrilled that they had Guinness on draft. I got a Nashville chicken sandwich "flippin" hot which is scorpion pepper. It was so good! I've had scorpion pepper before, and this was a good balance of heat to chicken to bread. I would totally come back here.

_niK4BNldhx1A1-KHw2vHw.text: Great service, really good food especially if your out drinking! They could probably use a new bartender though bc the drinks we ordered were gross! If your going just to soak up the alcohol then definitely go! They lose one star for the crappy drinks!

fswL_a1Zi08aziy6H8cOTA.text: Walking down freemont st. saw a sign for impossible burger; considering we have a vegetarian in our group this was a perfect stop for lunch.   Bill served us for lunch today. He was awesome!!! Super nice guy, our food was fresh and delicious, they had country music playing in the background, and nascar/hockey game on tv. Couldn't have picked a better place to stop by for lunch. Our party of 5 had a great time here. Would definitely stop by again when we return.

QwNUqYhe2grpyGOLo6KhQA.text: Absolutely hit the spot. The quality of the food was excellent and my food arrived hot and delicious. I was not disappointed and will absolutely order from them again with no hesitation.   My burger was hot. My garnishes were fresh. My fries were still hot. My chicken sandwich was delicious!   I was very very pleasantly surprised because it's hard to get burger delivery where something isn't cold or hot inappropriately. Good Job in the kitchen!

V3YwawvxLVGbrDpurJ3Z2w.text: Alright folks. I love Nashville hot chicken. And it's not that bad here at all! However, I'm not sure if our server was having an off night or what, but honestly, what the hell?   I think they were short staffed, I have no clue. Server Alexander comes over after sitting for a bit and takes drink orders. We are a larger group (6), everyone orders. Comes back with everyone's drinks. Doesn't bring the soda I ordered or a water for me. A friend asks for the water for me, he brings two. I ask for the Soda, it's like I'm bothering the guy at this point.   I really felt like I was a bother, I should've just stuck with the water because it seemed like he just didn't even want us there. Food comes out, it's definitely decent. Plenty of spice. Finish the soda, server comes by a few Times and never catches the need for a refill since he basically kept his back to me the whole time.   For $3 for a damn soda, give me a freaking refill. Whatever, who knows if we will come back. Our group was excited to try this place but it was flipping bad service.

H8aUwbIfhaHhe-FV81RKCw.text: Oh, Flippin' Good. How delicious you are. In all my life, I have never indulged in such succulent, moist (yes, MOIST,) flavorful, crispy chicken. Honestly, it is the best fried chicken I have ever eaten! I work Downtown and frequently order the Chicken Strips or the Dirty Bird sandwich (which is really delicious but extremely filling.)   Even their Texas Toast is mouth watering and the perfect juxtaposition of buttery, salty, thick and soft.   But be prepared to wait for your food. And I mean WAIT. It doesn't matter if there's one other table or completely packed, you WILL be waiting for your food for at least 25 minutes and that's being generous. I'm not saying it's not worth it (it is) but if you're in a rush, this is not the place to go.   My other disappointment is the service. I've been in a big group of 10, a group of 3 or 4 and even swung by for a pick-up and each time it's just really hit or miss.   Breanna is, by far the worse server in the joint. I hate calling people out, and she is very sweet, but I hope she's using her tip money to pay her way to a different career because this one is not for her. My party waited nearly 25 minutes just for water. Another 10 for it arrive, 20 for the food and another 20 to get the check AFTER we'd finished eaten. It wasn't that she "didn't care" it was more like she just completely oblivious. She wasn't adept at anticipating our (basic) needs nor was she even cognoscente of how long she had us waiting in the midst of a very, very empty restaurant.   Regardless, their food is superb, their happy hour is decent and you can't beat a free beer with the Yelp check-in. Next time, I'd love to try their milkshakes!

tHuTnMbLqkMl3AYJleALDQ.text: Was alright. The burgers were a good size but just not very flavorful. And that's cause I added condiments to my burger which already had cheese and bacon. I also added avocado. Nonetheless I felt it was pretty tasteless and didn't eat much of it since it lacked flavor. Very odd to be honest. Burgers usually have great flavor with little effort.   I also got their fried pickles and didn't realize they were a weird spin off. I guess with buffalo and other spices? Really did NOT enjoy them and I LOVE fried pickles. I tasted two and that was it. Would def not order again.   Fries are very plain. I like some good seasoning on mine.

7WuWswaf_rDoOHeEOH6fhw.text: Very good food (the group got chicken, burgers, fries, & shakes). The fries weren't very good, but I didn't even realize my burger came with fries and didn't want them, so it worked out. Service was great and the burger & shake were really good! They perfectly cooked my burger and didn't even flinch when I asked for medium rare - some places refuse to cook them that way.

9Xox0kCwmWV19z1vJO_XTg.text: Best onion rings EVER!! Burgers were great too. Nice atmosphere inside.   Service was good. The general manager was there when we were, but she just sat at the bar. Meh. Go for the onion rings. You won't regret it.

ikDZm6P60ySfy5xM9kZ54w.text: This is hands down the best burger in Vegas. They cook it exactly as you wish and I'm a sucker for fried egg on a burger. The burger has fresh toppings that are never wilted or crappy. The fries are even cooked perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Flippin' Good Chicken, Burgers, Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flippin Good Burger with fried egg added

dcgE9rXRCu6w7DXGBd8Pvg.text: Danngggg - this place is actually really flippin' good. I had to be sure so I tried it all, the burgers, the chicken, the specialty fries and I loved ALL of it.   The buns they use are the right amount of fluff and taste kind of sweet. They practically fall apart and they remind me of potato bread. The chicken - so flippin' juicy, so flippin' crispy. AND THE FRIES. They have these hot fries with jalapenos and cheese - maaahhh gawww - sooo good but definitely not for the one who can't handle the heat. If you can't handle the heat, they have their version of animal fries like in n out with the cheese, the sauce, and the grilled onions! Their specialty sauce is just like any specialty sauce that reminds you of thousand island and it's tasty!   I wanted to evaluate the menu before judging whether or not this place is flippin' good and it flippin' is. Service is awesome too! It can be about $10-12 a person, which is reasonable for the fresh ground beef patties or their fried chicken! Definitely a great spot to have a drink (there's a full bar) and grab a bite!

l42E_r88yJdEMzDxfT6Lrw.text: Absolutely love coming here! Coming here is always a treat for my friends and i after a long day. The staff are so nice and even recognized us by the second time we came in there! The chicken sandwich is truly FLIPPING GOOD! The spices are amazing and have so much flavor! Their French fries are awesome too which is awesome because it's hard to find a place with good fries and a good sandwich! Would definitely recommend this place if you're downtown!

y64XQI-xX7MkIA8RElZx5g.text: Great simple menu and cool location.  Service was good and the food was tasty. Chicken sandwiches were big and value was great! Vegan option was excellent. I tried the flipping sauce and it was definitely hot! No complaints here!

t4ZA2ybRpLb-XkH2Rv50Cw.text: Yum, yum, and excellent service. From the hostess Nikki, and our Server Briana, to our amazing food, this place was great! Our host Nikki was working with the right amount of friendliness and helping seat and clear tables. She should be a server in my opinion. Our server Briana was great and got us everything we needed with promptness, enthusiasm, and care. Our Chicken sandwiches were the bomb.com! A nice thin light fry to them tasty in our mouths. And Briana pointed out their homemade Chipotle honey on the table. Glad we took her advice and added it to our Chicken Sandos because it was delicious! Wish they had a Flippin' Good spot like this back home in San Diego

uOG6ndEMEttgUQaYeO1Z7w.text: I wish i could give Flippin' Good a five star review. The Vegan Chicken Burger and fries were tasty. The sandwich was kind of greasy, but still yummy. It's a good thing I like my fries soggy, but some people might find them a little undercooked. I also don't like the fact that there is only ONE vegan item on the entire menu. They also use the same frier for all of the items, vegan or otherwise. The rest of my party enjoy their food though!  Unfortunately, my water tasted like pool water (i could taste the chlorine). My boyfriend tasted my water and said it didn't taste like the water he recieved. I would definitely recommend a Water Filtration or Reverse Osmosis for the restaurant.  The service was wonderful! The server was attentive, kind, and very patient. We recieved our food very quickly! The bathrooms are well kept, which is also a plus. They have plenty of TV screens to watch all of the sports games at once!   I hope they add more vegan items (like a milkshake!), so I can visit again!

Until tonight when I was told I could not have a grilled cheese sandwich because only "under 12" year olds were allowed a kids menu item.   Even though I was having a premium beer and other menu items I could not have a grilled cheese sandwich.   Are you kidding me?  I have spent hundreds of dollars here BUT never again.   And since I live downtown and get requests from tourists about recommendations often I will no longer refer this place.   Rude staff and stupid policy will run you out of business quick in Las Vegas.    I imagine a closed for business sign is what you are striving for.

It wasn't bad food and the service was great so I give it 4 stars. I think I'm spoiled with all of my local haunts in my home state of Wisconsin. Go here if you find yourself without other options.
