lGFYAFeRLfHQjRY4k-o4DQ.text: Had a very bad first experience. The fried pickles and onion rings were better than the sandwich itself. The chicken was more sauce than actual seasoning. The server also took really long on everyones order. Never coming back

hyPF2Fo3ktkD7_6bo0aUuA.text: This place has come a long way in a short amount of time. My 1st time here was maybe the 2nd day after they opened and the food was somethin to forget about. After coming here again about 1 month later, it had become a regular spot.  The chicken is A1 and the portions are perfect for 2 people to share. The salads are my favorite thing to eat here and priced accurate for the quality and presentation.   A great place for family and friends.

nMYCle6WxIVkXVEiewuhHw.text: Great burgers, great fries and great shakes. Perfect for the late munchies. Very reasonable prices for what you get right outside the Fremont street experience. Dropped one star because they took off the Huckleberry from their Shake flavors; it was the best Shake flavor in town... RIP Since my review, Christina (The manager?) reached out, which is nice, saying they might reconsider in the future. There was no way to reply to her, but I just wanted to say that I understand it is a business decision, but I strongly believe it is a must-keep flavor if they just try to suggest it more. Everyone I suggested it to fell instantly in love with it; It is not as heavy or loaded as other flavors which are good too, but because most of my (and my roommate's trips) were specifically to get one of those (and a burger and fries of course), we decided it is not longer worth the frequent trip now that it is removed. We will still stop by when there of course, both the burgers and fries are delicious, but taking a star is my way of protesting the cancellation of this delicious and unique flavor which you cannot find anywhere else! I hope you bring it back someday....  :(((((

ynd1tf3M4du_qi7G-Dr_Yw.text: I've been here three or four times since their makeover and the food has improved across the board. Love their chicken and their burgers. Their onion rings are great, too! One of my favorite lunch spots now!

l94QHpVLjT3hH8AqqRFWvg.text: this was our first time here. due to all the hype on yelp we decided to try it out!!! we are happy we did!!! the service was awesome are waiter was very helpful and came to our table many times to make sure we were doing good me and my husband both ordered the crispy chicken sandwich  " vegas "hot and it came with fries!!!! to drink we got ice tea and  a lemonade! be sure to check in they give you a  "free beer" for checking in ;-) when we got our food it looked sooo good ..... not only did it look good but it tasted amazing, it was pretty dang  spicy lol  but tasty not overly spicy.... i actually enjoyed it!!! the sweet pickles tasted sooo good inside the sandwich !!!! we loved it..... we may consider getting the "Nashville" hot next time to see how that is because the "vegas"  hot was a bit hot  lol or we may just do the "vegas" again who knows depends our mood hahaha the price was very reasonable   for the amount of food served about $25 for two combos !!! anyways i highly recommend this spot if your looking for a spicy -hot crispy chicken sandwich with a  kick!!!! we will definitely  be coming  back again!!!!!!

cwedP7eRI2XZhjniilHjFA.text: Flippin good indeed.  Located in the gateway to East Fremont this burger joint offers fresh made food that will soak up any booze you might have consumed during the evening....or day for that matter because day drinking is fun!  You start by ordering at the counter and you can choose 1,2 or three patties (classic, large, or extra large). Then they have their specialties that include the Flame, Farm, Old Fashioned, BBQ, Cheese, or Bacon Cheeseburgers.    This visit I went with the large Bacon Cheeseburger and it was delicious.  Topped with traditional lettuce and tomato and some Flippin good sauce and crispy bacon, this is the kind of meal I needed to cap off a night of cocktails and beers in DTLV.  The natural cut fries on the side were seasoned and cooked well.  With a good size portion of fries and a double patty I did not leave Flippin Good hungry.  Reasonable prices make this a win for East Fremont dining.    Next time I'm gonna try one of their shakes. Their promo on the wall was promoting a St Patrick's day flavor which I bet is a 1000 times better than a stinky Shamrock Shake from McD's.

0W5uWCaOkHH4b_SmXTGD9A.text: HORRIBLE HORRIBLE SERVICE! Giving this place the benefit of the doubt was a BAD idea. Been here a few times to know that this place have always had TERRIBLE service but today was the final straw. If you want to come to a place where you watch everyone get their food before you even when they came 20 minutes after you this is the place to go! They "took" our order and gave us our water but that was the last of it.The waiters ignored our table we sat there for 35 minutes and no one checked up on us. When I finally talked to one of the servers they said they will check up on it, someone came by and spoke under his breathe and then went to another table. Didn't hear anything that he muttered. They obviously forgot about us. They offered no apologies so we left and this will be the last time we are going back.

Ordered a shake and came in a child size cup and didn't even look like what we ordered. Plus they forgot and we had to remind them because nobody made the shake. Food was good but will not come back and its to bad because we live here and enjoy supporting our business here in Vegas

jY7IanGMZuDpjzVz_NnD6w.text: Yummm! Yum! Yum! I was really craving a burger and I ended up here from good Yelp reviews and convenience. The food is pretty dang good and i was very pleased with my experience and I have no reason to give it less than 5 stars The fries and rings were fresh and yummy. The burgers were tasty and well constructed  and full of fresh ingredients, but they were not falling apart, soggy or difficult to bite. Limitless sides and extra ingredients. The contents of the burger stayed in between the buns til the end, as long as I don't get TOO many extra ingredients lol  It did exceed our expectations. Very good food, the prices were decent and the staff were great. Helpful, friendly, attentive, and quick. Simple menu with more than a few choices.  Also: Clean, well lit, laid back dining room.. at night it is in the middle of a fun, bustling location! Big TV playing music videos.  I would definitely come back for my next delicious fast food burger fix!! Day or night lol

photos.caption: Photo of Flippin' Good Chicken, Burgers, Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I like the texture of these

-8wSDx2ReBvs-j78vdO3og.text: Seriously friendly, good service. Very laid back atmosphere and delicious food. Everything tasted really fresh and was well presented. I feel like this would be amazing drunk food, but in my case it also made a great breakfast.  A really good alternative to the crazy heart attack burger place across the street. Reasonable prices and welcoming.

photos.caption: Photo of Flippin' Good Chicken, Burgers, Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg nog shake
Photo of Flippin' Good Chicken, Burgers, Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farm burger and flippin fries

6ggy94GGa1HZYWVo-dK3pg.text: Had this place delivered tonight. All food cold and items missing!!! Really!?! Wow.. You mark ass bustas! With so many burger places here in town, I won't be going back to this low rent grease trap. And the name of this place sucks too.

RWixFj5sfxjyPe3eFfJa9Q.text: The good: Casual eating smack in the middle of the Eastern Freemont Downtown action, reasonably priced for the location- burgers start at around $5, but are served a-la cart.  Clean, bright and family friendly. Beer on tap, and thank you lord, it's not just Bud Light and Shock Top- they offer Alaska Amber. At $4.75 for 16 OZ, it's not a bad proposition. Three kids items on menu.  Burgers are tasty, but not out of this world, just ok.  The "meh": Who doesn't love some kick? Be careful though, if you ask for jalapenos, you are getting JALAPENOS. Fresh, unseeded, and LOTS and of them, completely overbearing any flavor of the burger.  Fries are very average, and the "secret sauce" is little more than thousand island.  Shakes are tasty, but the picture in no way matched the finished product- none of the presentation or flare in the menu pic- it looks like a small boring plastic cup filled with a less than generous helping of whatever flavor shake you went for. Don't know that it's worth $5. Overall- ok, got that one crossed off the list, no need to come back.

JOdY68uPG2kNwGRVi1AXTQ.text: Great way to finish date night with my son his double cheeseburger and my vegan chicken sandwich were Fabulous *!*!*!* WHOO-HOO!

qHKnsQDbqCnzrEsAIwH-xw.text: This place has some of the worst customer service I have ever seen.  I  Stood there for more than four minutes before the bartender even Acknowledged I was there. The busser never did acknowledge me. When the bartender finally asked me if he could help me I told him I was here for a to go order he came back and said it's not ready and then went over to the bar to eat his food which was on the counter. Two minutes later without cleaning up the mess he bar he went into the back of the house and that's the last I saw him for the next 15 to 20 minutes before I left. The busser brought my food out and put it on the counter and then went back into the back of the house I went to grab my food and another employee came out and asked me what I was doing and I said where are all the employees this is my food and she said how do you know it's your food. Probably because I am the only one standing here waiting for the last half an hour.

DfKxJAwq97AjNwVeSIN41A.text: Didn't even get a chance to order. Young man behind the register felt leaning up against the wall/counter was more important than taking our order as we stood there. They were busy but if your leaning, doing nothing, I think you can at least say hello or take an order. 3 minutes later, no acknowledgement from anyone and we saw the orders piled up and other customers complaining/waiting for the food. No thanks, probably won't be back. This used to be a great spot. Service so poor I made this my first Yelp review.

UOSIZJCxwCtjprM8WU8Kkw.text: Really great burgers. Regular fries were really good too. 5-8$$ burgers, but totally worth it. Will be coming back in the future!

viXOOrl1z1ZM3wIfjWyNTA.text: I went on Saturday 2/25 @ 8pm and the entire experience was pretty bad sadly. I was so amped up to try this place too after seeing the reviews.   The place was filthy. All the tables were nasty and nobody was cleaning. We waited 30 minutes for our food. It wasn't exceptionally busy and I wasn't expecting this wait for a counter type of burger joint. My burger was so overcooked it tasted like a rock. The inside of it was grey and weird textured. The fries were inedible. I don't say that in jest or to exaggerate, they were rock hard bleached colored sticks.   The entire time we were there 5 orders got sent back to the kitchen. The manager looked frazzled I didn't bother her with my issues for a $12 meal. I may try it again, I think they just had a really off night.

s0t62VBCoHLNHLYHR72Sjg.text: I am giving this a one star but if I could I would give a 0 star. Service was terrible. Food was slightly worse. When we were ordering we asked what they recommended and Jennifer made an ugly face and said I don't know I don't eat here. She was not helpful and struggled to even get our order on the register.    The food was over priced and beyond greasy. They brought out our order and didn't bring out everything we ordered. When we asked about it Jennifer didn't even know what we ordered. We are the only people here and we had such slow and terrible service. Never again would I come here. Save yourself the trip and money.

HVvcjQOgIfuQUSkBQ_miFw.text: I made an order through Postmates so I'm not sure of the atmosphere in The restaurant or the employees but the food is great

A0hee4zd63pP-gmThY0QWg.text: First time in.  Delicious burgers and fries.  Clean, very clean, place.  Right at the Fremont/East Fremont area of downtown Las Vegas.

rs-ruv7melkrpMR4pU3CAQ.text: Great atmosphere. Great music. I had the farm burger. Delicious. Egg could of been a little runnier. Other than that. Good burger

78ziHsGNQg6ZgTf51oLdVQ.text: This place is perfect for Fremont, especially when you have kids. We were hungry and tried this place. The prices are not Vegas prices. Very reasonable. They don't allow outside alcoholic beverages, which is nice. You don't want a drunk ruining your meal, especially when you're starving! I had the grilled chicken and the turkey burger. It was perfect. The fries were yummy. Chicken tenders, the picky teenage girls loved it!  You want a great food at non-Vegas prices...definitely give this place a try!

RXo8YDxd3kFJEdFL4o2-EQ.text: Renovated the place, absolutely beautiful. Took the Huckleberry Milkshake the menu? No bueno. Huckleberry anything is hard to find. Very sad it's been taken off. Can get Huckleberry soda at the grocery store, but I don't drink soda. PLEEEEASE bring it back...

UEb2Vc9OHDEelAa-cJ0SIg.text: Walking along looking for something to eat.. awe it's lunch time.. let me try this " Flippin Good burgers & shakes".. Trying the BBQ Bacon Burger. . Yummy. . I like it a lot. My burger also has a Crispy onion ring on it. . Very Clean place on Freemont St Experience

photos.caption: Photo of Flippin' Good Chicken, Burgers, Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasty...

qTxLhYL0Q6nawSbyYn3oXA.text: Yesterday I was so excited to try this establishment chicken is my favorite food and I also follow them on instagram the food looked so good. I am very disappointed the chicken was so breaded I could barely get to the chicken and also the breading was super salty from the seasoning I had to peel off the breading just to eat the chicken. The flippin fries were gross the cheese wasn't very tasty, the only thing I liked was the macadamia custard. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone

PFnB70bzELubBbr1BkOJPQ.text: The cashier completely forgot I had ordered a concrete and started straightening. A bit over priced for a really small "concrete". I can get better service and more quality at Sonic. It's also very cold in here so bring your jacket.

The burgers were ok at best. No real flavor or appeal to them. Better flavor and appeal at other fast spots like Smashburger.

snmBw947_l2yh5-xQYbHDQ.text: I got the chicken burger and was undercooked and my husband got a pink cooked meat, saggy fries, and bathroom dirty and whitout soap

INAzN8xn0gb3UaExl6Fydw.text: I would give this place 10 stars if I could. The staff was so friendly to me and my little one, especially this young lady I wish I had gotten her name but sadly I didn't. She was so nice to my son and she even gave him an ice cream cone..it just really meant at lot to me and it made my day. I had a long tough day  today and these two employees from this place made mine and my little guys day we were so happy

Tr9z18oGYw77IR2UpmVj7g.text: The burgers here are amazing, it is a bit cold inside so I would suggest bringing a jacket, the shakes are just as good as the burgers. The modern decorations and friendly staff make me feel welcome to come back again.

ea-3PAoJzb-UJXcSCAwTlw.text: Went in a couple minutes before they were about to close. They told me they were already closed. Last time I checked you are not supposed to close until it says closed. Not going there again

Gka9zmcbmHkvSGsx9jT_FQ.text: Best burgers with EXCEPTIONAL service. Love coming here on my visits. Highly recommend!!!

7RpGF0aZ-nF9MrSx2b-h1Q.text: This place is perfect for DTLV. Inside is really nice and was way nicer than I expected. The food lives up to the hype as well. I had the brownie shake and it was full of chunks which are the best part in my opinion. You can also ask for a free cone of vanilla ice cream (shhhh). :)

-g6yVTu5BjbTi0StS9GEyg.text: I ordered a "The Old Fashioned".  I substituted the two beef patties for two turkey patties and American cheese for Cheddar.   Probably the best turkey burger I've ever had!  I was VERY surprised because it's a fast food joint.  The staff provided amazing customer service too!  I highly recommend going for a quick, inexpensive bite.

b7vcwQGA7hGfLzAZv5UljA.text: Delicious burgers! The ingredients were fresh and the pickles were super crisp. I also had the concrete and it was very thick. It was made with real ice cream and had chunks of banana in it. We were a rather large group (16) and the service was quick and orders were correct. First time there, but not my last.

PxLj6B556F96RZXYayoeIQ.text: Tried this place with my significant other for the first time last night and I must say, I was  very impressed. We usually do not eat at Fremont, due to the fact that we have not had the best food experiences here in the past. However, we decided to give this place a chance since we were downtown already and, hey! Who can say no to a good burger?! The menu has about six burgers, but we got the Flippin good burger and a side of fries. First, let me just say that I am happy that there is a place that does not over salt their fries. These fries are pretty damn good... They are fresh, and have the right amount of salt. The burgers were fresh, and the Flippin sauce was a good touch. You can tell by the taste and quality that they do use fresh ingredients, which is a MAJOR plus in my book, because who likes a poorly made burger. I didn't have a chance to try the milkshakes or ice cream ( mostly due to the fact that I was stuffed from the burger and fries) however, I do plan to return here before the summer is over or during the life is beautiful festival. If you enjoy burgers as much as I do, then please take my word for it and try this place out. :)

vbpy8uEUdKKxodaEpH_8Vg.text: Not only the best burgers and shakes in town but a great location also. And if your looking for a nice cool beer they have you cover with a great selection of draft beers! I highly recommend! Must try!

5kdZFfv_AwhNQJlQaM8lPQ.text: Unbelievable ...this new burger joint delivered to our business a great looking menu.   No prices on menu items.   We called the store to order and use the coupons,  however we get a recording on hours, & location etc.    They do not take telephone orders for pick-up and offer delivery for $4 thru a third party company.   I asked Dwight (mgr.)?  ... how can you be in business and not have a live person answer the phone .... take questions ... take an order etc.   He said sorry we don't do that ...   I give it maybe 6 months before they close .... remember Las Vegas has hundreds of places to eat.   Service is King!    Good Luck Flippin Burgers... I just Flipped you off my list!

P2AyVKscu34_XsYeB0bkIQ.text: We were looking forward to trying this place. We were very disappointed!! Place smelled like old grease. Wasn't very clean. Burgers were "eh".  The fries were the best thing. We will not go back!!

g1X9yw9R6lMEV_PETM7PdQ.text: The staff was nice, but bottom line is the burgers suck.  Got four different burgers to try them all out.  It took forever and all the burgers were burned,  some had almost no lettuce, and they got my order wrong.  Shake was decent but way too sweet, and straws were too flimsy to be able to suck it out.  Don't know if other yelpers were reviewing a different place, but it is hard for me not to enjoy a burger, and these took effort to eat even though I was super hungry.

HL-ZXsZkPzfEcetb1JvJ4g.text: Was expecting more out of the burger, but it was really nothing special. The chicken strips were awful, really dry and bland. The milkshakes were very good and would be the only reason that I would recommend coming in. Some members of the staff were great, others were not, but I'm hoping it is because they were new, otherwise they should think about hiring a cashier who speaks loudly enough for the customers to hear and knows how to count change.

bComGvdRhT9pnK_VCBdxOQ.text: Oh, Flippin Good Burgers, I've tried so hard to love you. Tonight was my third time here and while I waited for my food (10+ minutes) I decided to run to the restroom. When I leaned over to flush the non automatic toilet, I got splashed in the face with toilet water! So disappointed and then found out that my burger was on stale buns. Even though I work around the corner and love cheeseburgers I'm afraid the third time is the charm that will keep me away for good. I've never had a satisfying experience at this place.

4TngvoiDp9uddE14kL2wfg.text: No fuss burger and fries. Nothing outstanding or special about it. There are better places to eat in Vegas but $$$

qKbCCPkt2LwOoCJAhcTURg.text: Best meal and price we've had since getting to Vegas... Great burgers, great staff, and clean!

OL06qphuplsWPGDTedIXrA.text: This place was pretty good, especially for people who like plain food or picky eaters. We ordered a double cheeseburger, French fries, and chicken strips to share. The burger and fries were awesome- my partner enjoyed that he could pick the size of his burger, offering a small, medium or large and single or double party options. The fries were delicious, never frozen, seemed like the hand cut kind you make at home. The chicken strips were decent but tasted kind of like the oil they were fried in although they weren't greasy, just had an oily taste to them. They had a lot of options too, which I like, including vegetarian options like garden burgers and portobello burgers. They just seemed to have a lot of options all around, including turkey burgers, onion rings, chili cheese fries, a selection of draft beer, and an endless dessert menu of milkshakes and ice cream that we didn't really check out. There also were big screen tvs with the sports games on which is nice, and the restaurant was clean and on the cheaper side.

-KoIhfLLKDdpcbXgjohcVg.text: Uck, I want my money back. I went in to get a chocolate shake & it's undrinkable. A vanilla shake with chocolate syrup that is liquidy & not thick at all is not a milkshake. What is this McDonald's but more expensive? A chocolate shake is made with chocolate ice cream. Period. Definitely not worth $4.50. I'll never return.

APFh5dgXdO5YUTVm_f0tLw.text: Great veggie burger!!!  Made on site...delicious! Awesome spicy flippin' fries.  Great way to absorb the alcohol your husband ingested at Frankie's or anywhere downtown.  Yum!! But...the music is poopoo. Pooopoooooo muuuusic. It was so very yummy!!! The music was not yummy.

7dpTm4GbMtIFAwzm5RlplA.text: Friendliest staff at a quick serve burger joint I've ever encountered. Such a pleasant surprise.

n59aUVp494j2fFMEyRT4lg.text: First, the milkshakes here are outstanding. They should just stick to them. The burgers are not worth the prices they are charging. The management is not interested in the fact that while we were there for 30 mins, we saw 6 people come in and walk out. He sat in a corner, saw it, but didn't try to find out why they left. Bad business for a new addition to Fremont.  I am a local and would love to see them succeed but they need to make changes soon.

p61MlWC5bb96hDVDdIK6lA.text: Compare to the price everything was good and delicious. I ordered a classic cheeseburger with fries and liked them both.

hGrP538wlOSA6HeFge1-VA.text: I am all all time In N Out burger fan, but this place is right up there....we happened to go in for lunch on Halloween Saturday and I couldn't believe how clean this place was! They are a newer establishment on Freemont & LVB with a modern farmhouse feel inside and everyone was very friendly. The menu was pretty straight forward and very reasonably priced.  (THANK YOU FOR NOT CHARGING $5+ FOR A KID'S GRILLED CHEESE SANDWICH BY THE WAY!)  Our burgers were not greasy, the bun was so soft and almost brioche like.  I love their Flippin' sauce whatever it is and so did my 2 year old.  We tried the apple pie concrete and the custard was delicious and not too "eggy".  I don't know if it was a Halloween treat, but the nice lady who helped us behind the counter brought out a free small ice cream cone for the little one.  Will definitely be coming back when we are downtown!

cx7-8Gbk14XJcvOmtgA2_g.text: This place was so tasty. Came here with a gf for lunch the other day and we both got the bbq burger with flippin fries. It was so good! Not crowded at all considering it was lunch time. A bit pricey but I think it's worth. Will definitely be back again.

2eXDPsQrgWTlbWwnPoHnFw.text: Had the double farm burger with onion rings. Got a 20% discount from Yelp. Employees are amazing. Atmosphere is amazing. Easy in and out from Fremont. Great food and had a great time! Definitely will be back when I'm downtown!

4t4CgleePofdQLCJ9ufRWg.text: Seriously this place is horrible. The meat has no flavor at all. It felt like I was chewing paper so I unwrapped the whole burger thinking I accidentally got a piece of the wrapping. I do not recommend this burger place. I would rather have an In and Out. The only good thing was my strawberry shake.

ljJUMnNrguRG05BA8WRQ6g.text: Delicious!  "Best burger I've ever had!" said my wife.  Bold statement, but I would have to agree.  Restaurant was nice and clean, great atmosphere along with great food.  Definitely can tell food is fresh.  We would come here for sure.  If you are at the Fremont Experience, keep walking down and get your self a good burger.   You wont regret it.

SqjkKYUSBk-kZOcrdW9MOg.text: Found this place on yelp after we wanted a quick bite to eat and it was a great pick. The burgers were delicious. The only bad thing was the beer selection only 4 beers on draft, but the food was so good that I can't take a star away for that.

_4ccosPzb276sRr7OZNm2w.text: Keep in mind that this is a fast food joint. Burgers were good though the patties are slim. If you're hungry definately double up on the patties. Fries were ok though the onion rings were pretty good. Really like that they have beer on tap.

fmNXlTJiiVvRJcxarRe2Dg.text: Although we just popped in for a shake, the food looked really good, somewhat comparable to in n out style food. The shakes are made with frozen custard, we had the pumpkin... best pumpkin shale I've ever had.

XXN4Uw4xvM_e1V18NIehRA.text: This place is simply amazing. The service is outstanding Vonnyea the cashier was awesome , smiling and curtious made my experience here all the better. And the burgers and flipping good. I diffently reccommend this place

19VA6ljejH0e6m-cYCIQcg.text: Meaty but not super flavorful.  To be fair though, we didn't try the suspect, I mean "secret", sauce.

2-GtV4Z2zSdIP0II8M8W8g.text: As a major burger & fries connoisseur and extremely picky when it comes to somewhat quick food burger joints this is definitely one of the better ones in the Vegas area. Similar concept as In n Out but in my opinion a little better quality. Especially when it comes to the fries! Definitely worth trying!

FRnLjD9TO-7YbLQh7Pzhgw.text: The food is good, nothing amazing but definitely good quality. The shakes are average. The staff is friendly and the place is very clean. The prices are very reasonable as well. I would come back again.

Tq7dGGR1RzxOfIk5QWz74w.text: The milk shakes are good. The place was clean and well lit. I just cannot go to that area at night after work. The parking is a big problem when the sun goes down. I appreciate you adding to downtown, but as a parent, that location is always a gamble with children

jQ8olQOgu9cd_k7C-JntPQ.text: Really enjoyed this place! Very clean upon entering. No line. Took around 5 minutes to get the food. Had the flame burger while my fiance got the farm burger. Both were delicious. We paired the burgers with an order of fries and some onion rings. The fries tasted quite a bit like thicker in n out fries and they were delicious. If you like ranch with your fries, they have some good ass ranch. I would come here again and I felt the price was very well worth it.

6TtO2kldk9SEDKkE4_Zdrg.text: We came here for dessert. Nice inside, easy to sit down with the family. We had pretty much the range from the shake and custard menu. Everything was great

pOF3gtMo5Jdz6ejAbW_3Bw.text: My kids love this place! We went three times last week. My sons love the sliders and shakes. The burger with jalapenos is excellent. I haven't tried the loaded fries but they look pretty amazing. The restaurant itself is really clean and stylish- definitely upscale compared to most burger places. The service has been excellent at each visit. We live and work downtown and up until now didn't have a good go-to burger joint so we're thrilled to have Flippin' Good in the 'hood.

C-Kn9JuRYK3rUiof4Ol__A.text: First time visit today.....Best part of it all is that I live just a few blocks off Fremont, so it's handy for a quick lunch. Secondly, the food was pretty good - had a double turkey burger, fries & a coke for $10. A little pricey for a combo meal, but it's Fremont St.... The food was very good, fresh veggies & potato bun - tasty! The fries were made fresh - crispy & hot. Service was very good - smiles from the cashier, food delivered to my table within 5 minutes. Recommend for a quick bite to eat!

MvZhBJyY4W5chmX5sTatnA.text: solid burgers near the downtown fremont area, walking distance. burger was a good sizez for the price.

RXE8g1tDzPxCvA2QGSWQ2A.text: Romero and the girl at the bar with glasses didn't even seat a party of 2 or take our order. While the food looked very appetizing, I don't see the point in watching 2 people walk in and not seat is for 15 minutes. We ended up just calling them out on why they don't seat us, and walked out. Don't show up to work if you don't want to be there. Just my $.02

jZUrMMDA80YZvJRIquDtIg.text: Can we rename this location "Flippin' Average Burgers?" That'd be a bit more accurate.    Burgers are fine.  Fries are ok. Chili cheese fries are the only thing keeping this from being a total disappointment.

4BTwwSvSxuDYgWy7weq5dA.text: This place is .com! The flavor in their burgers and sandwiches are everything! Next time I'm in Vegas I will definitely be going back. My only suggestion would be to have tops for their shakes. I had a to go order and my shake was melting and running down my had while walking back to my hotel room.

8HJTv60TdiVxGN9xMpPOaQ.text: The burgers, fries and chicken strips were extremely salty!  That have potential to make a good burger, but way too salty! Maybe I came in on a bad night

EVh1TVnKrhJVcIc1IDIYpw.text: We had a big party with kids and they were very accommodating.  The service was great. I had a bacon burger.  It's was just the way I order it. So goood. The fried pickles was awesome.

bLLCpw9IwFlMpvbABGnWNg.text: The only place in Las Vegas you can get a Huckleberry shake!!!!  Burgers are big and beautiful.

photos.caption: Photo of Flippin' Good Chicken, Burgers, Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huckelberry Shake and &#34;Cookie Dough + Oreo&#34; concrete.
Photo of Flippin' Good Chicken, Burgers, Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These guys working hard, but stopped for picture time.

2000gMwB1Lr9PcbmGAYebA.text: The service was unbelievably slow. We didn't even have a server but just anyone who wasn't busy at the time. The food was really good and I liked the new look but I probably wouldn't go back. They were friendly but the time it took to get our food wasn't worth it.

1kcUxu4V9lmYIl_HTRgJVw.text: These flippin' burgers are so flippin' good!! They are all what they are said to be.. The Nsme says it all. I ordered their Farm burger. That sucka' had egg & bacon on it  was flippin' delicious!! But you want to know what was flippin' ridiculous?? We spent nearly $5 for 5 (I counted) flippin' onion rings!! How in the flip do you charge your customers almost $1 for one damn onion ring?? I was flipped off when I saw the portion. I even asked the girl that served us about this flippin' small portion & she looked as though she was in full agreement with my dismay!! I wanted more flippin' onion rings but we made due.. I had 2 1/2 & my husband did too.. I was going to be salty and was going to only give 4 stars.. but decided to be flippin' nice & give 5 because the burger was delicious & was under $5 so I'm going to flippin' forgive them for them onion ring hustling their customers. I'll definitely be back!! Looking forward to trying some of their flippin' ice cream concoctions & that Farm Burger. Old McDonald himself probably couldn't make a better flippin' burger!

1dKHseXWxaLasneyMFiXNQ.text: I would like to say first of all...i was not expecting the service i got when i came in here...awesome! The server, i'm sorry i cant remember his name, but when i do go back i hope he is there so that i can get his name n say good things to upper management about him! He was very friendly..being it my first time there i felt welcome..he was helpful with the menu items..i tried the classic flippin good cheeseburger..lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, flippin sauce n melted american cheese...i also tried the flippin fries..grilled onions, flippin sauce n melted american n cheddar cheese...both good.. but i loved the fries more!...i also tried the banana monkey frozen custard milkshake as recommended by server..i loved that too! N he brought it out to me n asked if my food was ok n do i need any utensils or napkins n told me tnx fo coming hope i visit again! I will! Awesome service that i did not expect from fast food place..which is why i give 5 stars..if not for that only 4 stars...food was good

photos.caption: Photo of Flippin' Good Chicken, Burgers, Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Flippin' Good Chicken, Burgers, Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front entrance
Photo of Flippin' Good Chicken, Burgers, Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic flippin good cheeseburger n flippin good fries...yummy

D_o6r0_4-rR7emNeWcAWxg.text: Went in there around 6:30, wasn't busy. Service was ok. But it was hot inside and the tables are really close. We order 3 double burgers and they came and were totally greasy. Now I like a greasy burger. But these were terrible. Even the buns were coated in grease. The burger had no real flavor. I would not eat there again.

O94qLXAe8NrTiGRPHY4xFw.text: I recently tried this place again and was very pleasantly surprised. When it first opened, I was not happy about it.  Currently however, it has really improved. The meat is quality and very tasty. It's a bit on the greasy side, but I like that. The double burger is the perfect meat to bun ratio. The fries are fairly bland but a little salt and a side or ranch can remedy that.    The concrete mixers and shakers are also really solid. They have a nice variety of ingredients that you can add for a customized creation or you can just pick a pre-made option.   The ambiance is clean and simple. They also have outdoor seating on Fremont st.

PFibxA884bisebFLFiF9PA.text: This place is flippin  awesome!!  I am not a big cheeseburger fan but I will drive across town to get a farm burger from here!!   My boss even had some of my fries and said how impressed he was.  Will definitely find excuses to drive over there lol  Staff is uber friendly too!

-ljApuqoVhVvXNunhrmTZw.text: This place is a hidden gem in a sea of expensive and ridiculously priced food.  We stopped in here starving but not wanting to eat at a fancy or expensive place. We came to the right place.  Their burgers and fries are AMAZING.  They were fresh and hot and reasonable portions for reasonable prices.  The  loaded fries were the best thing I have put in my mouth in a long time.   I cant remember what they were called but get them.  Just do.  I am still salvating over the fries and wish they had a flipping good burger in Washington State.

H1lGOC6oLDm-CqYgXF-JTw.text: Came back tonight hoping for the same experience we had last time. Food was mediocre at best. Service was not good. Felt like we were being rushed out the door. Disappointed to be back after such a pleasant first time. Wish the blonde bartender we had last time was here her attitude was so relatable and fun! Oh well

Hq5Ob4WOBzitHGSFI2Wq6Q.text: The bacon cheeseburger is really good but those chili cheese fries Nasty! Today I tried my first veggie burger (the garden burger) from here and it was flippin good lol also their fries are really good and so are their milkshakes.

-W04e-JOiqD_YJ1LvHXL_g.text: The Chicken Tenders were terrible, you shoukd be ashamed for sending the 3 piece tenders the way you did in my delivery order. I recieved 2 chicken nugget size pieces and a piece that was the size of a quarter. Do you check for quality? Or is it normal practice for you to send food out to your customers that isnt what was ordered, and if the 3 piece tenders is that size regularly, how the heck do you sell chicken?

zK7BOUF7-XXyV7yWB14tdQ.text: Must say hands BEST chicken sandwich I've had! Thanks so much for letting me find this place and the cheese fries yummmmmmm!

wiI5AlN4zgMsK2lCan-D3A.text: Juicy burgers and hot fresh fries! And very clean and workers are very nice and welcoming , one of their employees Lawrence even walked by to ask how the visit which many other places never ask all they care is about money, but not here they appreciate their customers. Would really recommend this place every time u visit Las Vegas.

wxrtfhKup3YulKsX3CVeJg.text: My friend Keith and I went in on Friday evening and sat at the bar. We ordered a couple beers and asked for menus. I've never been to this restaurant/bar so I had a couple questions. Our bartender Dylan was in and out of the bar but answered all of my questions. He then left the bar for several minutes before returning. When he finally came back we placed our order for a couple of burgers. Our food took longer than I'd anticipated considering the establishment wasn't busy. Our food came out and once I cut my burger in half I realized it was undercooked. I apologized and asked Dylan if he could have it cooked a little bit longer for me, which he did. When it came back it was cooked correctly. The burger tasted as if it were a frozen patty, stale and not flavorful. It definitely wasn't fresh beef. We finished eating and I went to the ladies room to wash my hands. When I returned the check had been placed in front of our seats. I had planned on ordering another beer after returning from the facilities so I was surprised to see the check. I asked my friend if he'd asked for it and he told me he had not. I was slightly taken back by this, there were many open bar stools and the restaurant had many tables open so I didn't understand why this had occurred. I probably wouldn't of been this  offended except for the fact that the couple sitting next to us and had ordered after we had didn't have a check in front of them. We waited for a minimum of 15 minutes before placing a form of payment onto the check. Mind you, the couple next to us still didn't have a check dropped in front of them. In spite of the fact that the food wasn't good I'd said to my friend at least the bartender is good.....I literally ate my words. It's incredibly insulting to of been treated in such a passive aggressive manner. I would not recommend this establishment to anyone, friend or foe

3KxTzyOOTeGBd1YmpF0xHw.text: Staff were very freindly, food is cooked to order. Ordered a turkey burger, fries, and onion rings. The burger was decent, I loved the fries and the rings were ok. Ordered chicken strips for the kids and I did not like them at all, kinda gross. The strips had a funny taste I don't know why I think it was the breading.  I would visit again if I am in the area.

QMpsl95zQ_9ShxM2DYfrYw.text: Really enjoyed eating and just plain hanging too. The staff there are super cool and know how to make you feel welcome.  Menu is straight forward with a good selection. Our server Saul was super cool and treated us impressively well. He go out order perfect and the food came out fairly tout suite. The food had an abundance of flavor which makes for a yummy meal and good times all around.  Lastly while not a huge selection on tap, they had awesome beers on tap.  I was impressed cause someone there has good taste in beer and shared it with the rest of us. They rawk and I recommend them highly.

8Mud6jney0tG-uP6baqaiw.text: Best chicken sandwich in Vegas! Also got the onion rings and they were the best I've ever had! We will surely be back to this place!

FuK0PuRlfaXXxdcPb22gVw.text: Maybe it's just me, but I feel like describing your food in the name of your establishment is a very risky move. We walked in here expecting "FLIPPIN' GOOD" food... and we were sitting there constantly asking each other, "Do you want some?" -- and not out of love, but because we just didn't want to eat what we had ordered. We literally walked out saying in unison, "Never again."   Located in the heart of downtown Las Vegas -- inbetween casino hopping & gambling on a Saturday night, we got a little hungry and were heading towards Park for some food. Saw this place across the street & decided to give it a try since it seemed pretty empty in comparison to the big crowd at Park. There is a reason for this obviously, but like I said, we were in a gambling mood...   And we lost by choosing this place. I don't know exactly what to say, except that it was bland, oily, and just... not flippin' good. I'll give it an extra star for the cleanliness of the venue & the fact there was no line I guess.

photos.caption: Photo of Flippin' Good Chicken, Burgers, Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onion rings, chicken tenders, chicken sandwich. MEH.

jXWydsH_Eyow-1bAMjz9ag.text: This place is Sooooo fucking good!  The Nashville Chicken sandwich is by far the best chicken sandwich I've ever had! This place shits on chic fil a!

photos.caption: Photo of Flippin' Good Chicken, Burgers, Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y4ziDqiPQQLFWFyqYucc7g.text: Loved the cheese fries and the chicken tenders!  Couldn't believe how great everything was since it was on Fremont Str!  They have happy hour from 3-7 too with drink specials but the food is their forte.  And they have TVs to watch football

8WlOvM3kjnMPEdQ-3Vjrvg.text: My daughter and I drove by here last weekend, so this weekend when we were downtown with a friend we decided to try it. Got seated right away, busy being St. Patrick's Day, but they still had tables open.  Our server was very nice and checked on us several times. The burgers tasted great along with the queso bacon fries. Small portion for the price. I'm willing to pay it, but thought it would be twice the size. However,  overall the prices are decent for a downtown Las Vegas eatery which is a bonus.  All of food was good, our server was friendly, the only drawback was the time to get our meal. I'll chalk it up to it being a drinking holiday and everybody ordered food at the same time. Next time I'm downtown and want a burger I'll be sure to go back here.

286ua6sTBMZfJ5NyYfOrhw.text: Was here before and after the remodel. The burgers of course are delicious but I have also had one of the chicken menu items, which was also delicious. I can never finish milkshakes but I did order one at one time, and it was also just as delicious. Would recommend as probably the best burger joint downtown or in the Fremont area.

PLNAaqQPFjCfcWmhQVjdQg.text: tldr  Came to carb up for the night ahead and went with some friends. The food was really greasy, small portioned, expensive and nothing spectacular. The place was presented well though, was clean and very packed.  Got: -crispy chicken sandwich: was expecting a lot more but was very regular. -chicken strips: small portion and not much flavor; had to use sauce. -fresh cut onion rings: extremely greasy.

P5DWIWRM-YFS4TvmE00lrQ.text: Thought we would check this place out as word of mouth said good things. We walked in on a Tuesday evening and we grabbed 2 Vegan burgers and some fries. There was a decent amount of seating to accommodate walk ins but no one to great you or seat you. We walked towards the bar and kinda floated about until I spotted some menus. I grabbed one and we took a seat at the bar and glanced over the options. We ordered one Nashville hot and one Vegas hot. A bartender showed up and I stared at him until he realized he had never seen us before and perhaps we needed to place and order or might like a beer... we placed our order ToGo which was also recommended by others. The food came out packaged well and smelled really good. We walked back to our place and got to work. The Vegas Hot is HOT! The Nashville was really tasty, you'll still break a small sweat but it's good! The fries were good too, lightly seasoned or maybe that was just salt! Either way... there is nothing healthy about this food. The presentation was well done and I could tell this was no fast food burger. It was layered well and surprisingly didn't fall apart while eating. The actual plant based party is smallish... but super well coated in the rub and adds for a lightly greasy but flavorful bites. As a vegan who eats cleaner than that most of the time... call this a cheat day??? I felt satisfied yet kinda gross haha. But that's junk food for ya! This place is worth a try if you're in the area and looking for bar food.

Hqal1cB8xgMknkP2EJZtkg.text: Saul was hilarious and accommodating of our changing group number. Excellent  good and service! Thank you Saul!

kBQ4Z7EU4CJAe0a5FR9L0Q.text: Bear in mind, this little review here is for the delivery, not dining in the restaurant. I ordered a Dirty bird sandwich with the optional upgrade to the Fire fries for an additional surcharge, and my partner got the 3 chicken tender meal with fries at the Nashville heat level, which is on the lower end of the Flippin' Good spectrum. We were both sweating and struggling a little bit with our food's heat levels, and I'm a seasoned heat-head who's braved fire chicken noodles from Korea, habanero salsas from countless taquerias, and "hell ramen". My respects to their spice mixer! The food was delivered quickly, and was still warm. The cheese sauce on my fire fries had dribbled it's way to the bottom of the container, but they were still edible if not super-crispy. My partner loved his tenders and devoured them and the fries all within the hour or so of their delivery. It took me a bit longer to make my way through the dirty bird, but that wasn't because it was undesirable in any way- it was absolutely delicious! Super crispy batter on the outside with juicy chicken on the inside. Throw on an egg and bacon? Duhhhh-licious! I ate the remaining fire fries the next day after, and while I still have some coleslaw leftover it's not so say it wasn't great- their portions are just that generous!

HQEvDR4BIbdDGdk22aN00Q.text: Flipping' Good was amazing! The food was delicious. I had a crispy chicken sandwich with fresh fries and it was really good. Our server Matt was very helpful.

GWxDu7JtRdTk5BHDFOnVCQ.text: Soggy fries. Dry bread. Bad service.  The restaurant was empty when we got there and we should've taken that as a sign. The fries were pretty soggy and the buns crumbled when we tried to eat the sandwich. The chicken wasn't anything special. Our server was very rude and spent most of his time with his friends at the bar.

7VjWMNWXIg7ExFXQ_dVVyQ.text: *Milkshake Review*  I went to Flippin' Good Burgers & Shakes for a milkshake after leaving Fremont St Experience.  I wanted something cold to cool down from the hot Vegas sun. I ordered a white chocolate macadamia crunch (vanilla custard with fresh baked macadamia nut cookies and Ghirardelli white chocolate sauce). My milkshake was delicious. All of the ingredients blended great together. Milkshakes are made to order, so expect a wait. If you like macadamia nut cookies, definitely try FGBS cookie milkshake. I will be back to try other items on their menu. Flippin' Good Burgers & Shakes is a good choice for milkshakes.

520k4y0vC0x5T35bnstHbw.text: I liked my chicken sandwich,the hot sauce "Vegas Style " was great. The bartender had a great personality. Prices on shots are a little high due to area I assume. My wife liked  her classic burger just a little bit to much mayo. We're locals and we will return. We own a small business and support small business.

k5pZcLU93eJm_s4_o7IRNw.text: BEST vegan chicken sandwich! I know some vegans or vegetarians do not eat meat substitutes however I do from time to time and was craving a little comfort food. The vegan chicken hit the spot and my husbands said his burger was delish. Thank you for serving a crispy yet juicy mea alternative!!!

xK4kDMx9oUu8bhGJBAbo-A.text: I hadn't been here in a while, the last time I was here it was a quick service restaurant. Now it is more of a sports bar. I had the vegan chicken sandwich and it was super crispy and moist. Taste almost like the real thing! It was pretty filling so I didn't order any fries. I would highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Flippin' Good Chicken, Burgers, Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan chicken sandwich-so bomb!

LMZW6I7r815R6VgZyFRbbQ.text: Megan's smile and service are out of this world. We ordered the farm, the vegan, the Nashville, the kids cheeseburger, the bacon burger and the onion rings. The chicken was juicy and tender, the burgers were perfectly cooked, the taste was invigorating. The portions are just perfect. And those onions rings are a must have.   We drank a Guinness and a Coors light (hint: check in on Yelp and you'll be thankful you did) a lemonade, a dr pepper and sweat tea.  The honey sauce is a must try!  The music was a perfect loud and a good mix. The hostess was super friendly and helpful eventhough we were a spicy disaster of a group of six including a high chair.   The place is unique and you can even enjoy some television with your family or friends.   We'll absolutely be back for seconds.

VwR7bONCsJ_zQNONKVd_vQ.text: Wow. Just had an amazing time. From the moment I walked in, I knew I had found a place I will come back to time and time again!!!  From the country-esque feel of the place, to the country rock music  playin' and to the plethora of beers on tap, this place just drips with the essence of a great time mixed with even better food! After we were shown to our booth, it wasn't long before trays of food were being delivered on silver "platters." Mountains of gooey cheese fries (small extra charge) and a chicken sandwich that puts all other competitors to shame. I went Vegas hot, which is ghost pepper based and it was amazing. Just the right amount of heat. On the table is a pepper infused honey, that is also highly recommended and if they sold it, I'd buy a bottle right now. The sweet tea takes me back to my days in the south where I attended College. Finally, I had a milkshake that I got to pick the ingredients and it was heaven. Especially on this 107 degree day!!!!  I highly recommend you guys and we will be back!!!

8QdT7g-M19FnZFlw7xvtCg.text: I really liked this place when I went. The location is great and the prices are great for the area. Don't forget to use your yelp check-in for a free bud light!!! I had the Nashville hot chicken sandwich. I chose the Nashville hot sauce and I wasn't impressed with the spice level of it, so I would definitely choose a hotter sauce next time. The only complaint I would have is that our waitress wasn't very quick to help our table. Overall great experience and I would go back.

k1owEuFxbnaRsBaN36_Y9g.text: Should be renamed Flippin' Amazing Chicken... because the food was AMAZING. I haven't had a good crispy chicken sandwich like the Nashville in a long time. Will definitely visit again.

I ordered the vegan chicken sandwich. I really enjoyed it, it was super country and had the texture of chicken. I would definitely order it again. I only wished they had more hot sauce other than tobassco. I ordered the sandwich with a side of onion rings, those were also really crunchy and delicious. For a drink I ordered a Jameson and sprite, drink was nice and stiff.  The bf ordered the farm burger. I tried the meat and it was so flavorful and juicy. I would go back and try a burger for sure.

RVf2qMyk9NE0TgBa3xgNGQ.text: Had a craving for fried chicken so I found this place.  I have to say one of the best chicken sandwich we had.  We both ordered the Nashville with fried and O-rings. It was awesome wish there was one in Houston.

a7K3jRyrmdaD4HV1smN_1g.text: This place looked so good. We got there and sat for about 25 minutes with no service, until we left. Waiters and waitresses walked by us numerous times and helped people who had come in after us. So we walked out.

Z9VZ4blXPbVhx6-7_J8vSA.text: This place was SO good! My friend and I were wandering around Fremont Street and she wanted a "good burger". Then we saw a flashing neon sign that said "Burgers!" Seemed like destiny.   Many choices of burgers. I got the Farm, which had a fried egg and bacon on it. The buns and the meat and seasoning here was a taste of a time I never really knew. It was like an old-fashioned soda shop burger... As I would imagine it! Fantastic french fries also. Can't recommend it highly enough.

FPkDwZkMEmDGEFx-eX7HZg.text: This place is so good! Small atmosphere but big taste. The Vegas spicy level was not that spicy so if you like really spicy, go for higher. The peanut butter dessert was amazing!   The only reason it wasn't 5 stars is because the fried pickles had a ton of batter on them. It was like eating batter with a little pickle in it.   Overall- service was good, food was good and place was small (and loud) but cool.

photos.caption: Photo of Flippin' Good Chicken, Burgers, Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States

heFjlxMLKPqO07-BQ_14sg.text: I saw this place on Instagram and what caught my attention was their vegan Chik'n Sandwich. I was so curious and I wanted to try it because it looked so good! My son's a vegan, I'm not but I like to try different vegan restaurants with him.  We came here on a beautiful Sunday, a perfect day to walk around downtown Las Vegas. We were seated right away. It wasn't too busy when we got there. We decided to order the vegan fried pickles but initially we were given the wrong dipping sauce. The server who brought out our sandwiches ended up getting us the vegan dipping sauce for our pickles. The pickles we're delicious and the sauce was kind of like a cool ranch type of sauce.  My son and I ordered the Vegan Chik'n Sandwich and my son's girlfriend ordered the impossible burger. I ordered the bacon queso fries with my sandwich.. like I said, I'm not vegan lol. Everything was good. Service was ok. For whatever reason it took forever for my son to get the beer he ordered but the waitress wasn't bad. The four stars is just because it took forever for that beer and because we got the wrong dipping sauce.

HK2O7V_HimrWv7GK2Rdmrw.text: Randomly ended up here with a group of friends and we were seated immediately.  I tried the Old Fashion burger and it had the perfect amount of toppings with very crisp pickles.  My husband tried the Nashville hot chicken sandwich (Nashville heat).  The chicken was very tender and heat level will make your nose drip. All burgers and sandwiches come with a healthy portion of fresh cut fries.  There is a honey sauce on the table that is so so good. I drizzled it on everything!  We also tried the mint chocolate chip boozy milkshake which was refreshing and not too heavy on the booze. We were all stuffed and satisfied with our food!  We would definitely go back here!!

-E19kN4dDtq6ws6j5w8ksg.text: Service is not good. Hostess was nice though. After she sat us, We sat for 20 mins and watched people around us (who showed up after us) receive water and acknowledgment from the servers. We sat as a table of 3 for 20 mins without any acknowledgement, so we left. There was a male server with tattoos and blonde highlights who tended to every table around us. Same with the girl with glasses. Super unprofessional. We walked out, set our menus on the tables, no one said anything. This pissed me off!!!!!!

YcwxnfzpUvafgYuY8WcqnQ.text: It is rather rare to find good eats late at night but this place is always a safe bet!   The service here is always great. Most of the time I just sit at their bar, the bartenders are very kind and down to earth, ready to serve and never got any attitude from all the times I have visited this place.   The food is really impeccable! Their fries are really good, and their vegan chicken sandwich is something to die for, I don't know how they do it and frankly, I don't care because it's delicious!   The price is moderate for this part of town, other than that, it's a great place to go.

tM0xVUoqcjISd-3GcAfiDg.text: My boyfriend and I were originally going to try a brunch spot across the street but after looking at the menu decided against it. All of a sudden we were in the mood for burgers so we saw flippin good burgers and I did a quick yelp search, it had great reviews. Our server Saul was a charm. He was very attentive and was able to respond promptly to our questions regarding burger choices. We opted for the bacon cheeseburger with avocado and we also got the Nashville chicken sandwich with Nashville spice. The spice had a tolerable kick to it but it was good and it is spicy! The burger was finger lickin good. Honest opinion about the chili cheese fries ???  I've had better. Not a fan of beans in my chili. Must try if in the area?

photos.caption: Photo of Flippin' Good Chicken, Burgers, Beer - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy chicken sandwich with fries.  I think it was the second one down from the hottest.  Also, chicken fingers and fries.

dHOO8TxIqtnn5ahvj_mRBA.text: Best chicken sandwich I've ever tasted! Reasonable prices for Vegas and great service. If you love spicy like me the Flippin hot is truly divine!

NsfcnKn8TH9-yU9BChbliQ.text: Nashville themed hot chicken establishment with a bar?! Yes please! I went straight to the bar and they are VERY attentive and helped me situate myself with what I was looking for. Loved the country music of course.  Bartender was professional, knowledgeable, friendly, and detailed. I mean. Perfect!  Ordered a Vegas level hot chicken which wasn't too shabby. It sneaks up on you but easy to eat for a spice lover. Note: softest chicken I've ever experienced. How do they do it?! So good.   The theme, service, cleanliness, and food quality makes me all happy inside. Thank you!!

bUX8QPJHVaWabcqxY19SPQ.text: Wow wow wow. I've never experienced a restaurant that has only one vegan option have that vegan option be oh-so-right.   The only way I was even able to be sure I had been given the non-chicken, chicken sandwich was once a bunch of the deliciously flaky, crispy coating had fallen off, I could see the more rounded-corner square shape the vegan bean curd had been molded too. Otherwise, I literally could not tell the difference in taste, texture, or appearance that what I was eating was vegan.  My husband was even so impressed that he sent a photo of the sandwich and it's inside texture to his friends. More than one responded in the same accord, "You better make sure that's vegan because there's just no way."  I also ordered my sandwich with onion rings. Those were equally as perfectly crispy and amazing. I ate almost everything on my plate, which is unusual for me. I highly recommend this place for the quality and care it puts into its food alone.

ysOHvzmNxHbZIcVYWsv_PQ.text: This place is legit Vegas got chicken sandwich. Good beer selection and ice cold. They have a honey chipotle sauce that is really good on the sandwich or pickles. The service is on point and if you have room for a shake they are tasty.

ZLlv36BcvQNmUOBlczyFVA.text: Love this place , however ... I ordered the crispy chicken sandwich through Postmates and the bacon queso fries. My sandwich was inedible , i couldn't even eat it. I don't know if the chicken wasn't fully cooked or it was over cooked because the chicken was really tough. Huge disappointment . Made it even worse that i was starving and looking forward to this only to be left still starving .  The fries were still pretty good . S2j6vld1VjjtToKRwAU57w.text: I can not believe we ate at this place. The fries taste like they came straight from the microwave to our table. xdaa6JhYDVvmx50pxVYR4w.text: Holy crap, guys. I mean, Ho. Ly. Crap. So, I gave up red meat when I was a kid, on a whim. So I've been eating fish and poultry my whole life. You become a bit of a connoisseur of poultry after a while: it's easy to over-cook and many people slather it with sauce to "mask" the dry, tough, inedible mess they just made. This is DEFINITELY not the case with this restaurant. I work with a bunch of picky eaters and we tried this place cause it's close to work and Uber Eats delivers. We all ordered different chicken items from the menu, prepared different ways (fingers, spicy, grilled, crispy, etc) and everyone raved at how good their meals tasted. These things are HUGE and if I could have finished the whole thing in a sitting (which I can usually do, no problem) I would have because I just didn't want the chicken-induced happiness to stop. I'm not even done yet and I'm already writing this essay to make sure you don't pass up an opportunity to eat whatever heavenly thing you're considering on their menu. AND I'm already thinking about what I'm going to order for next time.  Look, do yourself a favor and order the Dirty Bird with avocado and a fried egg. Grab extra napkins. Wear stretchy pants. Do what you must and after you do, send me a message to thank me.  P.S. I would have included a picture but the aftermath wouldn't have been pretty and wouldn't do this restaurant any justice.

kys2FBqW2VoNdueY2VCYDw.text: Soo disappointing.  Two stars, because they actually offer vegan options. Unfortunately, they are not that good.  First off, they advertise local/special beer, but for the flights, your choice is 4/5 of the 5 options that they offer...lol. Two of which were IPAs. No browns on the menu exc 10% ABV Imperial Stout & Guinness....k. I just expected more given the beer in the title. If they didn't advertise their beer, I wouldn't gaf. Just bad marketing there. Their cocktails seem more interesting, but we didn't get one, so I can't comment there.  The vegan onion rings were the best of what we had. The fries weren't bad.  But the vegan chxn burger.......ufff. It was just really seasoned & if you don't like the chosen seasoning, you are SOL. Idk if it was cumin or some rub or Frank's Red Hot or what, but I kinda couldn't escape it in a bite, 'cause it wasn't just the sauce, it was IN the breading on the chxn. The bun was like a school bun & soggy on top & hard on the bottom.  The waitress actually said, "You don't like it?", which was super awkward to me, haha.  I understand that it's located in a touristy area near Fremont St, but $56 for a burger meal & drinks for two peeps is steep, considering we aren't at the Wynn/Bellagio or something.  All in all, I appreciate catering to a veg crowd, esp. given the "down home" theme that this place has is usually very un-vegan friendly...but I just wish it was done better. I would hit this place up all the time if all of the boxes were checked.

jitzh5u70vCOOIPImhYjCQ.text: I saw these amazing chicken sandwiches all over Instagram & I just had to try it. I had the Nashville Chicken sandwich at "Vegas" spice level and I was DYING! I love spicy food & my spice tolerance is pretty high but this whooped me. Keep in mind... I finished the entire sandwich and my spicy fried pickles because despite the intense spice level... IT TASTED SO GOOD! I was crying, snot running down my face but I enjoyed every second of it. Next time I'll make sure to try it at a lower spice level. Absolutely amazing, will be coming back!

47dabgx12cPHoXTCUMEukA.text: My boyfriend and I came here when we were visiting for the Mint 400. The food is great! I got the chicken sandwich and it was crispy and simply amazing. Renee our waitress was really sweet. The sweet tea was amazing too! Really good atmosphere.

CxnEWjRCml74S_TBpm0-qA.text: Arrived specifically to eat their amazing Nashville chicken sandwich. Sat at the bar, the bartender didn't look my way for 10 minutes. When he finally noticed me, he told me that he thought I was with the group of 6'+ Australians that were already seated at the bar. Mind you I am a 5'-5" Hispanic with a bald head.  He then proceeded to ask me to leave because someone else was seated in the stool I had occupied for 10 minutes without him noticing. They definitely need to either better train their employees or get some that want to serve customers. Only reason they got a one star is because they have good food.

yFMKDEw0DzPhZyz9-EOw-g.text: I have never changed my opinion on a place as much as this place did. When it first opened up it was essentially an in n out knock off that was nicknamed flipping mediocre. Which is why when my mind was blown when I walked in here recently and it was completely different. The inside has been remodeled to have more group friendly seating. The menu has also streamlined to be burgers and chicken sandwiches. The food is definitely of a higher quality and you get to choose your heat with the chicken. I will say the Vegas and the Flippin can get pretty hot, so beware before you order.   My only two gripes with them is that sometimes the wait can get a bit long and you just have to roll with it because it's right in the middle of downtown so that's understandable. My other major issue is that you don't get fries, or any side when you order a burger or sandwich. If I'm paying $9 for a burger, I shouldn't really have to add $4 more for fries or onion rings.

qNvJIInLgR0dVEO9MwBbzw.text: Uggghhhhh what did they do to this place?? When Flippin' Good first opened downtown, it had an open, laid-back, kind of a diner feel to it. The food was about a 7/10, but we enjoyed going there every now and then for a casual and good work lunch. Then they re-modeled it and tried to turn it into a more formal, classy bar type of joint. Now it just feels stuffy inside and the food is no longer worth the higher prices they are charging. This is a tough review to write, as I want everything downtown to succeed, but I am disappointed in the direction in which they took Flippin' Good.

34PF_VowAP1Sx_5KKgUiDw.text: Flippin good! Great for vegans, vegetarians and meat eaters. They have a VEGAN breaded chicken sandwich complete with vegan aoli and everything! It's super delicious. You have the choice to get your sandwich plain or choose a level on the heat scale. Nashville level is a dry rub. It will leave a lasting impression and then you will be reminded about it again the next day. Plain is perfect and delicious. They also offer vegan fried pickles which come with the Nashville rub but I think I will ask for those plain the next time too! The bartender was thoughtful enough to bring me a cup of the vegan aoli to dip the pickles into while my friend enjoyed the ranch it typically comes with.  The place is not large but they have always been attentive. I know they also serve the impossible burger but I'm not sure if you have to order it special to make it vegan. They seem to be really knowledgeable about what is vegan and what is not, which is SO appreciated!

9gchTpO4PDa8aZ0BIhep4w.text: Popped in here one day for some lunch. They have great options of fried chicken sandwiches, burgers and salads. They offer some really fun adult ice cream drinks.   We were really hungry and wanted to try their fried chicken sandwiches. One of us got a traditional fried chicken sandwich and the other one was the Nashville hot chicken sandwich. I also decided to get the dirty Girl Scout which was an alcohol-based ice cream drink that was absolutely delicious!   Now there were four different versions of a hat I could choose from for my Nashville chicken sandwich I went with the second level which I have to say was quite hard. Next time I think I would go with the lowest level. It was delicious and crispy came with lettuce, pickles, and onion. We each ordered fries with our sandwiches which were fantastic cut right from the potato and deep-fried.   Overall if you're down on Fremont Street and you're looking for some good chicken sandwiches and burgers I would definitely give this place a try. Super fun atmosphere! The staff is really friendly and nice! Overall it was a great time!

HUBSx_e7LW0AWPs-JL3hpA.text: Vegan chicken! Vegan onion rings and fried pickles. This "chicken" was to die for (or to live for) and I'll be back every time I visit Vegas. On historic Fremont street, so super cute area.  You'll have to pay to park somewhere but DONT MISS THIS SPOT. Their food is great, vegan or nonvegan (they have actual chicken too... like dead animal chicken for those who like that). Scorpion pepper and ghost pepper dry rubs are options for the more daring members of your party. Buffalo sauce and flippin sauce top it off!! The fried pickles are a MUST!!! Half our group loved the onion rings and the other half thought they were too "hard" but vegan onion rings are hard to come by so I say go for it.   The vegan chicken will fool your friends -- it's that real, it's that good.

u36o0bJRnJ-Cpgq7paTTAw.text: It truly is Flippin' Good. I've been here a few times now with coworkers for lunch. We're typically able to luck out and get a table quickly, but I imagine on weekends that this place is packed. The inside has a college bar type feel & features a full bar. They carry a lot of local breweries on draft which is always nice & they have alcoholic milkshake options.   As for food I've tried two things so far, the impossible burger & the nashville hot chicken sandwich. The impossible burger was kinda meh for me. I personally like the flavor of beyond meat better, but still kudos to them for having the option. The nashville hot chicken sandwich is the real winner. The chicken is juicy & the breading is perfectly crispy. I personally don't think it's very hot so if you really want something spicy go for the vegas hot. The fries and onion rings are both tasty. I like to mix their chipolte honey sauce with ketchup for the perfect dipping sauce.   Give them a visit if you're in the downtown area for sure!

KfjpW-qdYamXdVJFQb7FuQ.text: So when I got a job working downtown I thought this would be a place I frequent ALOT let me just say I want to give one star but due to my prior five star experience I will give this place a two .. thing is I've ordered to go via yelp since starting work downtown on May 28.. never once had a problem or a wait ...  Enter in ordering from the yelp site I got a chicken sandwich paid the $2 for onion rings also placed a note asking for ranch and most definitely ordered before they opened told it would be ready at 11:15..  I arrived a bit early the hostess was acting all stressed still putting up umbrellas for outside but she was like oh I just put in your order and offered me water but it was a beautiful day so I hung out plus I walked around took pics of the restaurant fully expecting just to upload those but not change my review .. However the hostess who I pre tipped 20% and would've ended up giving cash just wasn't friendly cept in that fake way and she legit didn't try to align or relate to me I saw another lady helping folks outside who was nice but my sandwich was a hot mess and barely fried and soggy so I waited for what? Worst part I had no ranch and since I waited longer for my food than I recently waited sitting down to eat at Thai I had to come review that this place has gone down hill .. sad to say u won't be back but I hope sitting down service here gets you food like I had the first time but if you get to go be prepared for errors and missing items and not worth it food that got a tip they didn't earn

E0kdzsTb00--y95fbygRhA.text: OMFG. Last Monday we were hungover after St. Patty's in Vegas (and watching the Oilers lose in Vegas for the second year in a row). We were "Vegas'd Out" (that is an actual term, right?) and killing our day before heading to the airport in the early evening. We lost some money at Binions and decided the hangovers had subsided enough to eat. And frankly, we were a tad ravenous by that point.  We started (bin 702) and ended (Flippin' Good) this Vegas trip with vastly different but comparably amazing eats. Flippin' Good was just what the doctor ordered on a hurting early Monday afternoon.  We shared a peanut butter banana milkshake to start, and while the presentation wasn't anything like the way it looked on the menu it was frigging delicious. We each ordered chicken burgers... Heather the Nashville Hot Chicken Sandwich and me The Dirty Bird. Heather opted for a side house salad and I went all in with Bacon Queso fries.     A comment about the heat levels here as reviews seem to differ. Heather and I LOVE hot food and can handle heat. Like, very hot. We both ordered our sandwiches as Vegas Hot spice level (with less than great stomachs we didn't want to risk the highest "Flippin" level when getting on a plane later...). I can tell you as a guy that loves heat that Vegas is planty enough heat. It is perfect in my opinion and will get you sweating a bit and the mouth salivating uncontrollably.    The burgers were huge, delicious, spicy and perfectly greasy. They were literally perfection for our damaged carcasses. The sides were average, but these burgers will have me back when I can enjoy an adult beverage with them (I couldn't think of booze that day). We raved about Flippin' Good Chicken when we arrived home and look forward to returning in our future Vegas adventures.
